Sumia took a deep breath as she approached Henry's tent. Why was she getting nervous about this? He'd just wanted to help her learn magic, right? Still, what he'd said the last time she spoke to him nagged at the back of her mind, telling her something was wrong here.

The last time she saw Henry, he'd asked if she wanted to try her hand at dark magic, and after she accepted, told her to give him time to get things ready. It all seemed innocent enough, well, as innocent as you could get when it came to dark magic. However, before he left, he said one last thing that made Sumia worry.

"I've always wanted to ride a pegasus, after all."

What did he mean by that? He wanted to ride a pegasus? What did that have to do with teaching Sumia dark magic? Sure, she was a Pegasus Knight, but how was that relevant? Did Henry want her to teach him how to ride a pegasus, in exchange for him teaching her how to use dark magic? As far as she was aware, pegasi only accepted pure-hearted women as their riders, so how could she possibly get one to allow Henry to ride it? None of it made sense, no matter how long she spent thinking about it. As such, she did her best not to think about it.

That all changed, however, when she suddenly received a note in her tent. She didn't know when it had gotten there, but it was apparently from Henry, asking her to see him in his tent. She had no doubt this had something to do with the magical lesson he'd promised her. On one hand, she was excited. She'd always been somewhat curious about what using magic was like. but on the other hand, Henry's odd remark made her feel uneasy. Regardless, she still made her way over to his tent.

Quietly pushing aside the flap that served as a makeshift door, she peered inside. She saw Henry standing in front of his desk, flipping through the pages of multiple different books, and scrawling things down on a piece of paper. He was so focused on what he was doing that he didn't even notice Sumia slowly entering the tent.

"Um, Henry?" Sumia said, trying to get his attention.

At that, Henry suddenly dropped his quill and turned around. "Sumia! You came!" Despite his words, he didn't seem surprised at all, as if he knew she was there the whole time.

"Well, you did leave that note in my tent."

"Alright," Henry said, rubbing his hands together eagerly, "Ready to start casting some spells?"

"What did you have in mind?"

"Nya ha! You'll see."

Henry seemed to be preparing to cast a hex, but to do what, Sumia had no idea. Little did Sumia know, Henry's idea of teaching her to use magic was very different than what she had in mind. He had deemed that Sumia's body didn't have enough magic to cast spells, or at least, the spells he was willing to teach. The "obvious" solution was to put Sumia in a more magical body. Specifically, his body. Like he'd told Sumia, he'd always wanted to ride a pegasus, and by switching bodies with her, he'd be able to kill two birds with one stone.

It should've been a fairly standard hex, although he'd never actually tried it before, let alone on himself. As Sumia watched nervously, Henry cast the hex, expecting to find himself in Sumia's body, and she in his.
111332221221.title: Something to do with Henry

1113322212212.content:
Sumia watched as Henry cast a hex. She was a little confused, seeing as Henry refused to explain anything. Was she supposed to be learning from this? Was this preparing her to use magic? Nothing seemed to be happening.

As Henry started to finish up his incantation, Sumia began to feel something. Was this magic? It felt almost like something tugging on her entire being. The feeling got stronger and stronger, becoming harder to not worry about. "Uh, Henry?" Sumia asked, not sure if this was supposed to be happening. The only response she was got was Henry's trademark laughter, as he waited for the spell's full effects to take place.

With a swift tug, Sumia almost felt like she was pulled off her feet. However, her body din't move any inch. That didn't mean nothing had happened, though, as Sumia was now staring at the back of her own head. Looking down, she found herself to be in some sort of ethereal form, sticking out of her body's back. Henry's spell was literally pulling her spirit out of her body! She wanted to scream or shout or something, but no sound came out. Before she could do anything else, another tug pulled her spirit completely out of her body, and sent it flying off in some random direction.

Unbeknownst to Sumia, the exact same thing was happening to Henry, but since he knew the effects of the hex, he wasn't too worried. Well, until the final step, that is. If he had performed to hex correctly, his spirit should have flown into Sumia's body, and hers into his. Instead, he found his spirit flung in a random direction, apparently having a different target in mind. He wasn't too worried, as the hex could be reversed fairly easily, even if he accidentally got more people involved in the swap. He just hoped it wouldn't be too difficult to find Sumia in whatever body she ended up in.

Sumia wanted to scream as the world whizzed past, unable to slow down her ethereal form. She really wasn't sure what Henry had planned, or why he would do this. What was going to happen to her spirit now? Would it simply fly around aimlessly without a body? Would it return to her own body eventually? Would it seek out another body to take over? She soon got her answer, as her spirit headed strait for someone else in the area. Who was her spirit heading towards?

Owain wondered aloud as he normally did, "Have I discovered some kind of legendary weapon?" Not hesitating a bit, Owain quickly walked over to the sword, stepping around the bodies of the fallen ruffians, and picked it up, bewildered by the glow it gave off. As the glow began to grow brighter, Owain found that pain was starting to course through his body, starting from the hand that gripped the sword, before moving throughout his entire body.

"Now I see," Owain muttered, sweat beading on his forehead as he continued his monologue through the pain. "This was no legendary blade, this is a trap laid by some dastardly villain! Unhand me this instANT!"

To Owain's surprise, his voice cracked at the end of his proclamation, raising a few octaves. He coughed a bit in an attempt to clear his throat, but no matter what he did, the raised pitch seemed to stay.

"What kind of foul trick is this?" Owain couldn't deny how feminine his voice sounded now. If he didn't know any better, he'd think this sword was turning him into a...

Before Owain could think it through any further, the pain suddenly intensified, all over his body. It was as if it were trying to overwhelming, but against all odds, Owain remained not only conscious, but standing. It did halt his dramatic monologue, however.

Through the pain, Owain was able to observe strange changes happening to his body, new changes popping up everywhere the pain touched. His limbs seemed to be shrinking, thinning out. They still seemed to be just as strong, but their muscles were far less pronounced. However, despite the thinning, his thighs seemed to accumulated a small layer of fat, enough to make them appear shapely, though hidden beneath his pants.

"What is- GAHCK!" Owain cried out as a loud snap reverberated through the clearing. His shoulders and waist had pushed inwards, compressing his frame, and his hips had done the opposite, growing outwards. Though still physically male, his physique was looking decidedly female now, and it seemed Owain was soon about to match where it mattered.

He couldn't help but notice the pain seemed to intensify in one area in particular. "No, please..." he grunted through the pain, sounding far less dramatic than he usually did. Alas, he was powerless to stop it, as that which lay hidden inside his pants shot back up into him, inverting into its feminine equivalent. Between the pain, and the myriad of odd feelings now coming from his groin, Owain was unsure of how he was still standing, but he had little time to think this fact over, as the pain redirected itself somewhere else. Before he knew it, his chest practically exploded outwards, a large pair of breasts pushing out from underneath his top, threatening to rip it if any more pressure was applied.

"I... I'm..." Owain was at a loss for words for what was going on. There was absolutely no denying it; the sword was turning him into a woman. He only got a small glimpse of his new lithe, feminine form before the pain concentrated in his face, forcing his eyes shut. He held a hand to his head, while the other still gripped the blade, feeling his hair growing longer, falling over his hand and shoulders.

Before the pain could cease, Owain heard a ripping sound, followed by a fluttering of fabric around his body. If he had to guess, his outfit had ripped apart, and was reforming into something else. Under normal circumstances, it would sound like an insane suggestion, but considering he had just been transformed into a woman by a strange glowing sword, it seemed about on par with what else he'd experienced today.

Before long, the cloth settled down, and the pain ceased. And then, at long last, the blade dropped from Owain's hand. Slowly but surely, Owain opened his eyes. The first thing he noticed was the green bangs, falling into the edge of his vision. Swishing behind him was a long green ponytail, falling down to his knees. His pants seemed to have disappeared completely, while his shirt had stretched out into a blue dress, with slits that reached a little too far up the sides, exposing practically all of his shapely legs.

Though his mind should have been reeling from his sudden transformation into a woman, there was something else that caught his attention. "This outfit..." Something seemed oddly familiar about the outfit he was wearing. He'd never seen it in person, but he was sure he'd seen it before. Eyeing the blade again, he peered over at it, teetering slightly from his new centre of balance, and caught a glimpse of his reflection.

"Lyndis!" Owain shouted, his dramatic tone sounding odd in his new voice. "Lady Lyndis of Caelin!" Owain had heard many tales of heroes from other worlds, stories drifting through the Outrealm Gate. Lyndis, more commonly known as Lyn, was one of the heroes he'd heard of from the land of Elibe. Somehow, this blade had transformed him into an exact replica of Lyn.

"I have been gifted the form of a legendary hero!? Perhaps... perhaps this was fate?" Owain stated, still trying to keep his dramatic flair despite everything. He wasn't really sure how to feel right now; whether he should be upset about being turned into a woman, or whether he should be pleased that he had been reshaped into such a famed hero.

There was one thing that was for certain though; this blade was his. He hadn't immediately recognised it, but now that he'd become Lyn, he realised the sword did in fact resemble the blade she was often depicted wielding. Whether it was the genuine article, or simply a replica, it belonged with him now. And so, he reached down to pick it up, wondering what he should do next.

11133222222221111.content:
Miriel entered Anna’s store, hoping the saleswoman had acquired some new books or tomes she could possibly use. As she walked in, Anna was counting the gold she had made from a previous sale, but looked up and smiled at Miriel as she walked up to her.

“Ah, Miriel,” said Anna. “I was just about to go looking for you.”

“Oh? Did you have something you wanted to sell to me?”

“Not quite,” said Anna. “See, one of my suppliers recently delivered a bunch of strange potions and tomes from one of the Outrealms, and I have no idea what any of them do.”

“Do you wish for my assistance in ascertaining the effects of these potions and tomes?” Miriel asked.

“Yes,” said Anna. “If I know what these things do, I can figure out how much they’re worth and start selling them.”

“If I assist you, will I be allowed to keep samples of these tomes and potions for further research?”

“Sure, so long as the samples aren’t too big,” said Anna. “I’ll even give you a cut of the profits. Say, twenty percent?”

“Very well,” said Miriel. “I accept your terms.”

“Excellent!” said Anna, holding her hand out. Miriel shook Anna’s hand, and Anna led Miriel around to the back, where the potions and tomes were being kept.

“Okay, here’s my stock of those tomes and potions I mentioned,” said Anna. “How do you want to start?”

“I believe it would be best to start by testing the effects of one of these items,” said Miriel.

Anna paused. “Are you sure that’s a good idea?”

“You wish to understand the effects of these items, correct?” Miriel asked. When Anna nodded, Miriel continued. “Then the fastest way to determine that would be through testing these items on myself, assuming they actually work.”

“Okay, fair point,” said Anna. “Where do you want to start?”

She then put the bottle to her lips and began drinking the purple fluid. She quickly drank the potion, and passed the empty bottle to Anna.

1113322222222111121.content:
The pain in Miriel’s head grew even more intense, and soon her neck and shoulders started aching as well. Her vision grew blurry as the pain grew even stronger. Somehow, Miriel was able to stay standing, even though she felt like her head, neck and shoulders were on fire. After about a minute, the pain began to subside, and started to regain sensation in her head and shoulders as her vision began to clear. As her vision came into focus, Miriel realised that she couldn’t feel her glasses on her face… except she could also feel her glasses resting on her nose. She also felt as if her right ear was brushing up against something, even though it wasn’t, and she had a similar feeling with her left ear.

“Miriel?” Anna asked quietly. “Are you alright?”

“Yes,” said Miriel. “I believe so.” Miriel’s voice sounded strange in her ears. It sounded as if her voice had an instant echo. Miriel cleared her throat and looked at Anna. “Why are you staring at me like that?”

“Here, you’d better see for yourself,” said Anna, taking Miriel’s hand and leading her over to a mirror. Miriel gasped when she saw herself in the mirror. Miriel reached up with her hands, and placed her hands on her outer left and outer right cheeks. Unless she was hallucinating, which was unlikely, Miriel now had two heads. Her left head was wearing her glasses and hat, while her right head was bare.

“My goodness,” said Miriel, both of her mouths speaking in unison as she blinked with four eyes. “Well, it would seem that particular potion causes the growth of a second head.”

“So... um, is that, you know, second head, are you, well, are you, er, two people or one?” said Anna, stammering nervously.

“I believe I am a single person, rather than a pair of conjoined twins,” said Miriel. She held her right hand up to her right jaw and held her right mouth shut as she opened her left mouth a few times, trying to get better control over her new head.

“I guess they weren’t kidding about doubling your brains,” said Anna. “You literally have two brains now.”

“A most unusual development. However, it is not unpleasant,” Miriel said, saying the first sentence with her left mouth and the second sentence with her right mouth. Miriel turned to look at Anna. “Do you have my glasses in stock?” Miriel asked.

“Uh, yeah, I think I’ve got a few pairs,” said Anna. “Why?”

“My glasses were not duplicated when my second head was formed,” said Miriel with her left head. “Thus, I require a second pair of glasses for my new eyes,” she said with her right head.

“Oh, okay,” said Anna. “Yeah, I’ll go grab a pair. Be right back.”

While Anna walked over to another corner of the storeroom to pick out a pair of glasses, Miriel stayed in front of the mirror. She brought her hands up to her necks, and began running her hands against the inner right and left sides of her necks, enjoying the strange new sensations.

“Here you go,” said Anna, walking up to her. “One pair of glasses, free of charge.”

“My thanks,” said Miriel, unfolding the glasses and slipping them onto her right head. With her second pair of glasses on, her vision cleared up completely.

“So, how does it feel?” Anna asked. “Having two heads, I mean.”

“As I said, it is not unpleasant, though the initial transformation was quite excruciating,” Miriel said with her left mouth. “However, I may need some time to fully adjust to my new body.”

“If you need to take a break, that’s fine,” said Anna. “I’m sure all these tomes and potions can wait until tomorrow. If you’re still interested in testing them, that is.”

“Of course I am still interested,” said Miriel. “I must learn how this magic works, and how to replicate it.”

“That’s the spirit!” said Anna. “So, do you want to keep testing now, or wait until tomorrow?”

Lissa looked at the broken Physic staff in her hands and sighed. With her staff broken, she needed to get a new one if she wanted to help out on the battlefield. The only problem was, they’d run out of Physic staves, and Lissa wasn’t particularly interested in using a Mend or a Heal staff. She’d heard that Anna had recently received some new items, and she hoped that included some new Physic staffs, or possibly even a Recover staff.

Lissa pushed open the door of Anna’s store, causing the bell above the door to ring.

“Hey, Anna,” Lissa said as she walked in. “Do you have any-- gyaaah!”

Lissa screamed and stumbled backwards, tripping over her feet and landing on her butt. The two-headed monster turned around and spoke.

“Ah, Lissa,” she said, using her left head. “My apologies. I did not mean to startle you.”

“M-Miriel? Is that you?” Lissa stammered.

“Yes, it is,” said Miriel with her right head as she held a hand out to Lissa. “I am surprised that you did not recognise me, as we have known each other for some time.”

“Sorry,” said Lissa as she took Miriel’s hand and allowed the two-headed woman to pull her back to her feet. “It’s just that... well... you have two heads!”

“So I am aware,” said Miriel with her left head. “It is the effect of a potion I recently purchased and imbibed.”

“You... you drank a potion,” said Lissa slowly. “And it gave you a second head?”

“That is correct, yes,” said Miriel.

“Wow,” said Lissa. “That’s amazing!”

“Yes, the magic behind the transformation is most intriguing,” said Miriel with her right head. “I am planning to assist Anna in testing the other potions and tomes she received recently.”

“Wait, you mean there are more things like that?” Lissa asked.

“Oh, yes,” said Miriel with her left head, retrieving a notebook from her bag and holding it out for Lissa. “Anna made a list of the potions and tomes she acquired in this notebook. However, the descriptions are rather vague, and I was planning to decipher them.”

“Sounds like it would just be easier to pick something and try it out,” Lissa said as she took the notebook from and started flipping through the pages.

“Were you planning on volunteering as a test subject?” Miriel asked with both heads in shock.

Lissa blinked in surprise, both at how loud both of Miriel’s voices were, and at hearing it twice. “Whoa, that was weird,” Lissa said. “But yeah, I’m going to volunteer.”

“Very well,” said Miriel with her left head. The two-headed woman turned to Anna, who was counting gold at the counter. “Anna?”

“I heard everything,” said Anna, setting a small stack of coins aside. “That’s your change, Miriel. Now, if you two will follow me, we’ll head to the storeroom and find something to test on you.”

Lissa nodded, and followed Miriel and Anna into the storeroom. Once Lissa arrived, she saw Miriel holding a red glass bottle containing a purple liquid.

“This is the potion that gave me two heads,” said Miriel, returning the bottle to a crate full of similar bottles. “I do not see much reason for you to consume one of these.”

Lissa nodded. “I was gonna try something else, anyway.”

“All the tomes and potions in this part of the storeroom were part of the same shipment,” said Anna. “They’ll all probably have some sort of effect on you.”

“Is it permanent?” Lissa asked.

“No, there’s a staff that I can use to turn you back to normal,” said Anna.

Lissa sighed in relief. “Okay, that’s good to know. Now, which do I pick?”

Anna gasped as the pain in her legs became unbearable, and she collapsed to her hands and knees. She winced in pain, squeezing her eyes shut as it felt like her legs were on fire. She could feel torn fabric around where her butt had originally been, which was now rubbing against the sides of her new extended body.

“You’re not quite a centaur,” said Lissa’s original body. “More like a human centaur. A humantaur?”

“That would be grammatically incorrect,” said Miriel’s left head. “While a centaur is a distinct mythological beast, using taur as a suffix in this case would be akin to calling Anna a human bull, which Anna is clearly not.”

“So you have a better idea for a name?” Lissa’s new body asked, standing up and facing Miriel with her arms folded.

“Well... no,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Yeah, I didn’t think so,” said Lissa’s original body, also standing up and walking in front of Anna. “I think I’ll stick with humantaur. What do you think, Anna?”

Anna nodded. “Humantaur is as good a name as any,” she said. “Now, can you give me a hand standing up?”

“Sure,” said Lissa’s original body. Lissa’s original body knelt down in front of Anna and took her hands, while her new body walked around beside Anna and wrapped her arms around the new part of Anna’s body. It wasn’t exactly like a torso, and since it connected Anna’s front and rear legs, she was starting to consider it like a bridge, her bridge.

“Okay, put your left feet on the ground,” said Lissa’s original body, lifting Anna’s torso into an upright position as she started lifting Anna’s bridge with her new body. Anna put her front left foot on the ground, and also felt the bare sole of her rear left foot touching the ground.

“That’s it,” Lissa’s original body said. “Now the right feet.”

Anna did the same with her front right foot, and also felt her rear right foot mimicking her front right foot’s actions.

“Okay, now up we go!” Lissa said using both of her bodies. Lissa’s original body pulled Anna up by her hands, while her new body lifted up Anna’s bridge, bringing Anna up to all four feet.

“There we go,” said Lissa’s original body, letting go of Anna’s hands.

“That wasn’t so bad, was it?” Lissa’s new body said as she let go of Anna’s bridge and stepped in front of her.

“Easy for you to say,” Anna said. “You’re not the one who has to get used to having four legs.”

“Yes, about that,” said Miriel from her right head. “Lissa, could you please step aside? Anna, I would like you to try walking towards me.”

Lissa’s original and new bodies stepped back, with Lissa’s original body on Anna’s right and Lissa’s new body on Anna’s left, clearing a path between Anna and Miriel. Anna concentrated, and tried to take a step forward with her front left foot, but her rear left foot also stepped forward.

“So, you’re saying I’m thinking too hard about trying to walk with four legs?” Anna said. “And that’s what’s making it so hard for me to walk.”

“I do not know yet,” said Miriel with her left head while her right head read from the notebook in her hands. “I can tell you that the description listed here is, I quote, ‘A strange tail.’”

“Yes, this does make for a rather strange story,” said Maribelle.

“I believe the description is a pun,” said Miriel’s right head, looking up from the notebook. “The spelling used here is for the body part, rather than the synonym for story.”

“So, it’ll make you grow a tail?” Lissa’s War Cleric body asked as her Sage body pulled out a grey tome from one of the nearby boxes. “That’s so cool!”

“Y-yes,” said Maribelle hesitantly. She looked past Lissa’s War Cleric body at Lissa’s Sage body, which was performing the incantation from the grey tome. Orange words spiralled around Lissa’s Sage body, and the dress she was wearing was shortened and reshaped to fit her normal hips. The third shoe, which was still on the floor, also vanished without a trace.

“I wonder what kind of tail you’ll get,” Anna said. “Maybe it’ll be like a horse’s tail.”

“That is possible,” said Miriel’s left head.

“However, the tail could be similar to that of a cat, or of a monkey,” said Miriel’s right head.

“There’s only one way we’re going to find out, though,” said Lissa’s Sage body as she walked back to the others, carrying the grey tome.

“Just, don’t panic, okay?” Lissa’s War Cleric body said. “The transformations from the potions are pretty painful.”

“I suppose it’s too late for me to back out?” Maribelle asked.

“No, of course not,” said Anna. “If you really don’t feel comfortable doing it, you can walk away. I promise, none of us will be mad at you.” Anna gave a pointed look at Lissa’s bodies.

“No, I won’t be mad,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “A little disappointed, maybe, but I can see why you wouldn’t want to do this.”

Maribelle paused for a few seconds, her gaze flicking between Lissa’s faces and the potion bottle in her hands.

“I will only test this one potion,” said Maribelle. “And I expect to be restored if I am unhappy with this change, am I clear?”

“As crystal,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Very well, then,” Maribelle said. She removed the stopper from the bottle, and briefly sniffed at the potion inside. She may have been imagining it, but Maribelle would have sworn she caught a brief scent of elderberry tea. Steeling herself, Maribelle put the bottle to her lips and drank the potion quickly. Once she finished, she passed the empty bottle to Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“How long does it take for...?” Maribelle started to say, before she felt a sharp pain in her backside.

“Not long,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body, putting the empty bottle down and taking Maribelle’s hands. “Don’t worry, you can get through this.”

Maribelle couldn’t reply, as the pain in her rear was growing stronger, causing her to grip Lissa’s hands even tighter.

The pain in Maribelle’s rear turned into a sharp pinpoint at the base of her spine, and she felt something pressing against her pants, until her pants finally gave way with a rip. After about a minute, the pain stopped, and Maribelle found herself panting in a most undignified manner.

“See?” said Lissa’s War Cleric body gently. “That wasn’t so bad, was it?”

“Easy for you to say,” Maribelle said shakily. “You weren’t the one being transformed.”

“Speaking of transforming,” Lissa’s War Cleric body said. “Can you turn around? I want a good look at your tail.”

“My... tail...” Maribelle said softly as she looked over her shoulder. She couldn’t get a very good look at it, but she could just barely see a long tail poking out behind her.

Maribelle turned around, allowing Lissa’s War Cleric body to see the tail.

“Can... can you describe what the tail looks like?” Maribelle asked. “I’m afraid I couldn’t get a good look at it.”

“Sure,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. “It’s longer than your legs, but the end of it is curled around so that it doesn’t touch the ground. It also doesn’t have any hair on it, and it’s the same colour as the rest of your skin.”

“Do you think you can control it?” Lissa’s Sage body asked, walking around in front of Maribelle.

“I don’t know,” she said, turning to face Lissa’s Sage body. “I think it’s rather obvious I’ve never had a tail before.”

“Okay, maybe this’ll help,” Lissa’s Sage body said. Maribelle felt a hand what felt almost like her spine, even though it was definitely far lower down than her spine should have been.

“Can you feel that?” Lissa’s Sage body asked, as Lissa’s War Cleric body ran her hand up from the tip of Maribelle’s tail slowly.

“Yes,” said Maribelle, her eyes wide. “Yes, I can feel your hand on the... on my tail.”

“That’s good,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “I’m going to start lifting your tail up now. You ready?”

Maribelle nodded, and she felt Lissa’s War Cleric body place a hand near the base of her tail, while she kept her other hand near the tip. Lissa’s War Cleric body began lifting the tail up, and Maribelle felt the new muscles in her tail moving. Maribelle felt Lissa’s War Cleric body curling her tail, so that it curved up from the base, then curved down again about half-way down the length of her tail, then curled in at the tip.

“Do you think you can hold your tail in this pose?” Lissa’s Sage body asked.

“I... I think so, yes,” Maribelle said.

“Okay, I’m going to let go of your tail now, okay?” Lissa’s Sage body said, and Maribelle could no longer feel hands on her tail.

“Hey, look at that, you’re doing it!” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

Maribelle looked over her shoulder again, and got a better look at her tail. Like Lissa had said, it was hairless, and was the same colour as the rest of her skin, but she still wasn’t sure how she felt about it.

“Is there a mirror here?” Maribelle asked.

“Yeah, just follow me,” said Anna, walking over to another part of the storeroom.

Maribelle let go of Lissa’s Sage body’s hands, and followed Anna over to the mirror. Walking felt rather strange, as she could feel her tail bobbing in time with her walk, as well as swishing from side to side slightly as she walked.

“Here you go,” said Anna, stopping in front of a full-body mirror.

“Thank you,” said Maribelle, stepping in front of the mirror and turning to the side. She could see her tail poking out of her pants in her reflection, and turned different ways so that she could study it from different angles. She even found that she was starting to be able to move it to a certain degree, though she was nowhere near as skilled as Anna was with her four legs, or Miriel with her two heads.

After getting a good look at her tail, and thinking long and hard, Maribelle finally made a decision as to what to do with her new tail.

Maribelle slowly walked over to the crates containing the tomes and potions to be tested. "Why are only some of the crates labelled?" she asked.

"Those are the ones we've already tested," Anna answered. "The unlabelled crates just have a vague description in the notebook."

"Lovely," Maribelle muttered under her breath. She didn't exactly like the prospect of going in blind, but she assumed Miriel would at the very least tell her the description of whatever item she chose before she had to use it.

Despite the glow, Maribelle seemed to be completely unchanged, much to the confusion of everyone in the room.

"You got it!" both of Lissa's bodies said, as they sat Maribelle's body up, and started putting it back together.

Now in one piece again, Maribelle stood up and dusted herself off. "I must say, that is without a doubt the strangest thing I have ever experienced," Maribelle, looking at herself to make sure her body wasn't simply going to collapse again.

"Yes. It feels the same as if it were attached, only it isn't." She quickly reattached her hand, appearing to be normal once more.

"So," Lissa's War Cleric body said, clapping her hands together, "what's next?"

"We have another normal body here to test another tome or potion," her Sage body said, gesturing to herself, now only having two legs.

"Actually, I'm quite fascinated by Maribelle's ability," Miriel's right head stated. "I believe it would be wise to discovered to limitations of it before we proceed with any more testing," her right head concluded.

"Well, Anna, what do you think?" Lissa's War Cleric body asked.

"Huh? Me?" Anna said, caught off guard. She had been busy thinking about how exactly to market these new items. Considering how most people would react, they're probably be a tough sell, the potions especially.

“First, I would like to test which parts of your body can be removed, and how many pieces you can be separated into,” Miriel’s right head said.

“I suppose that is acceptable,” said Maribelle. “Where should we start?”

“Isn’t it obvious?” Lissa’s War Cleric body said, walking up behind Maribelle. “We start from the top.”

Lissa’s War Cleric body placed her hands on the sides of Maribelle’s head and lifted. With a barely audible pop, Maribelle’s head came off her neck.

“Lissa!” Maribelle said, turning around to face Lissa’s War Cleric body. Or rather, her body turned around to face Lissa’s War Cleric body, as her head was unattached.

“Okay, okay,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. “I’m sorry, Maribelle.”

“I know you didn’t mean to offend me, darling,” said Maribelle. “I am still adjusting to all of this.”

“My face?!”

“Great,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. Lissa’s War Cleric body sat down and crossed her legs, and put Maribelle’s head in her lap.

“This is a rather strange perspective,” said Maribelle as she tried to shift her head into a more comfortable position.

“Yeah, well, it’s about to get weirder,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Oh, and can you put your hands on your hips?” Lissa’s Sage body said.

Maribelle scrunched her face in concentration as she did so, unable to see her body from where she was. “Like this?”

“You mean, like this?” Maribelle said, straightening her arms, and feeling a slight bit of resistance as her torso went higher than it normally did. Her surprise at this caused her to lose her grip on her hips, and her torso started to fall, but Lissa’s Sage body caught her body before it fell.

“Sure thing,” said Anna, walking over to Maribelle’s detached legs.

“Hey, Maribelle, can you turn your legs around to your left a bit?” Anna asked.

“Like this?”

“Yeah, that’s good,” said Anna. “Now, take about three steps forward.”

Maribelle tried to nod as she complied.

“Okay, stop there,” said Anna. “Now I’ve got some room to work here.”

“Miriel, are you taking notes?” Lissa’s Sage body asked.

“Of course I am,” said Miriel’s left head, which was watching the proceedings while she looked at the notebook in her hands with her right head.

“Great!” Lissa’s War Cleric body said. “Then let’s get to work.”

And with that, Lissa and Anna got to work taking Maribelle apart into as many pieces as possible. Lissa’s War Cleric body worked on Maribelle’s head, while her Sage body took apart Maribelle’s arms and torso, and Anna disassembled Maribelle’s hips and legs.

Maribelle tried to nod, having forgotten that her head wasn’t attached to her neck anymore.

There was silence in the storeroom for a few minutes as Lissa and Anna took Maribelle apart into as many pieces as they could think of. Lissa’s War Cleric body had removed Maribelle’s mouth, her nose, both her ears and eyes, and even her hair from her head. With her eyes detached and placed on the floor, Maribelle found she could only see the ceiling. Lissa’s Sage body had taken the arms off of Maribelle’s torso, and had found that Maribelle’s arms could detach at the elbows. Her torso shivered when Lissa’s Sage body had reached into her shirt and removed her breasts from her torso, then peeled her nipples off her breasts. Meanwhile, Anna had detached Maribelle’s legs from her hips, then split her legs apart at the knees. Anna then pulled Maribelle’s feet from her legs, then took her feet out of her boots and detached the toes. Once she had finished removing the toes, Anna reached into Maribelle’s pants and removed her genitals, much to Maribelle’s embarrassment.

“Is that really necessary?!” Maribelle’s disembodied mouth yelled as her detached eyes looked around wildly and her head flushed with embarrassment.

“Hey, you wanted to know how many parts you could be broken into,” Anna said.

“And I have no intention of testing the three-legged potion myself, thank you very much,” said Maribelle.

“Very well,” said Miriel’s right head. “We shall await Lissa’s return.”

Anna nodded. “I’m going to get back to checking my inventory,” she said, pointing a thumb over her shoulder.

Miriel nodded her heads, and returned her attention to the notebook in her hands as Anna walked through the storeroom, taking stock of what was present in her shop. She also made sure to check how many potions and tomes were left. She’d received ten types of potions and ten types of tomes, with three boxes of each type of potion and tome, with twenty-four potions or tomes in a single box. Since Miriel had drank two of the two-headed potions, she only had seventy of those potions left, whereas she still had seventy-one of the humantaur and three-legged potions. Likewise, she’d sold the duplication tome to Lissa, which had been used twice, while they had the clothing alteration and detachment tomes resting on top of the boxes they had come from, so she still had seventy-one unused tomes in each of those three boxes. Anna had also found five more restoration staves in her stocks earlier, bringing the total number of restoration staves to six.

While Anna was checking her stocks and Miriel was copying the information from Anna’s notebook into her own book, Maribelle decided to simply stand and watch the other two women. While she had initially considered Miriel, Anna and Lissa’s transformations to be freakish, she had found that, after spending some time with them, she found their new forms to be rather interesting. She was fascinated by how Miriel was able to split her focus between the two notebooks, reading from Anna’s notebook with her left head while she used her right head to focus on her writing in her own notebook. She also found it strange how Anna’s rear feet were the ones she started walking with, rather than her front feet. Maribelle had also noticed that Anna had checked one the higher shelves by stepping up onto one of the lower shelves with her front feet while leaving her rear feet on the ground.

After several minutes of waiting, the three women heard the door to the shop open, and heard voices filtering in from outside the storeroom.

“Lissa, I fail to see what’s so important that you had to drag both of us out here,” said a woman’s voice that they recognised as belonging to Robin, the tactician of the Shepherds and Chrom’s wife.

“That’s because what I want to show you is inside the storeroom,” said Lissa. “Duh!”

“I don’t see Anna around,” said Chrom, Exalt of Ylisse. “Are you sure we’re allowed in there?”

“Yeah, we’re allowed in,” said Lissa. “In fact, Miriel, Anna and Maribelle are all waiting for us.”

“Interesting bunch you’ve gathered,” said Robin as the door to the storeroom opened. “Wonder what they’re... doing... here...”

Robin’s voice trailed off as she saw Miriel and Anna’s altered forms.

“Robin?” Chrom asked as he tried to get through the door past her. “Is something... what in the...?!”

“Surprise!” said Lissa’s War Cleric body as she pushed passed her brother and sister-in-law and walked up to Miriel and Anna. “Anna got a whole bunch of new potions and tomes, and we’ve been testing them. Turns out, they do some pretty crazy things.”

“That’s a bit of an understatement,” said Robin, her gaze darting between Miriel’s two heads and Anna’s four legs, before settling on the seemingly normal Maribelle.

“And are you altered in some way?” Robin asked Maribelle.

“Not anymore, thank goodness,” said Maribelle, shaking her head. “We used a staff that came with these potions and tomes to return me to normal.”

“I see,” said Robin. “So you’ve been testing them to make sure they work?”

“More like, to see how they work,” said Lissa’s voice from behind Robin and Chrom. The two turned around to see Lissa’s Sage body walking in behind them.

“See, all of these things came with really vague descriptions,” said Lissa’s Sage body as she walked past Chrom and Robin.

“For example, I used a tome that said it would allow me to be in two places at once,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Now, I’m one person who has two completely identical bodies, both under my control,” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“That’s... that actually sounds interesting,” said Chrom, recovering from his shock.

“So, I’m guessing you brought us here because you wanted us to help you test this stuff out,” Robin said to Lissa.

“Yep!” said Lissa’s Sage body, as both of her bodies smiled at Robin and Chrom.

“We also figured it’d be a good idea for you two to know about this stuff,” said Anna. “I was planning on selling it here in Ylisstol once we’d figured out what it all does.”

“I see,” said Chrom. He looked at Robin briefly, and she smiled and nodded at him.

“Well, our schedules are pretty clear for the rest of the day,” Chrom said.

“We’d be happy to help you out,” Robin said.

“Yes!” said both of Lissa’s bodies, and she hugged herselves in excitement. She then walked her War Cleric body over towards the potions, and her Sage body over to the tomes.

“So, who wants to go first?” Lissa’s War Cleric body asked.

“And what do you want to try out?” Lissa’s Sage body asked.

Everyone stared silently at Robin's extended arm, as it slowly retracted back to it's normal size. "Well, I think I found out what the tome does," Robin said, putting the tome down more carefully this time.

"Interesting," Miriel's right head muttered, as she began making notes. "Does your skin feel any different? More elastic, perhaps?"

"Feels about the same to me, aside from what I can do with it," Robin replied, already testing out the extent of her new ability. She'd found she could pinch and pull her skin out further than it should reasonably go, in addition to the previously discovered stretching.

"You've gotten the hang of that pretty quickly, huh?" Chrom noted.

"It's not that difficult," Robin replied. "It's just like controlling my arm normally, only it goes past where it normally does."

"Is it just me, or is your arm, um, curving in ways its not supposed to?" Anna asked, noticing how Robin's arm looked while she had it stretched out. Rather than simply growing in length, and still bending at the elbow, her arm had curved along its entire length.

"Huh, I guess it is," Robin said, not having noticed herself.

"I suppose that would explain the description in Anna's notebook," Miriel's left head stated. "If you are no longer forced to bend solely at your joints, that would certainly improve your flexibility," her right head concluded.

"So, is it just your arms that can stretch?" Lissa's Sage body asked, as her War Cleric body continued to toy with the skin on Robin's arm.

"I doubt it, considering the illustration on the tome, but I suppose there's only one way to find out." Robin quickly pulled her arm back to its usual length, before making a face of concentration. Without warning, Robin's legs suddenly grew rather quickly, her pants untucking from her boots as they refused to stretch with her body. She put her hands up to stop herself, her legs stopping their growth as she pressed against the ceiling. "Well, I think it's safe to say it's not just my arms," she said from her place at the ceiling, looking down at the others in the room who watched in awe.

"I said," Robin shouted back, before her head started to descend towards the group, her neck stretching to accommodate, a smirk on her face. "I think it's safe to say to say it's not just my arms."

"Well, no," Robin said as her legs and neck started to retract, "But while I've got this ability, I might as well use it." As she finished retracting back to her usual size, she noticed her pants were no longer tucked into her boots. "Although it's a bit inconvenient that my clothes don't stretch with me."

"Or, it could end up being a wasted use of the tome, with her clothing not needing to adapt to any immediate changes," Anna interjected, not sure it was worth using up a use of the tome just to test that.

"Well, what do you think, Miriel?" "Is it worth testing?" Lissa's bodies asked.

The headache spread from Robin’s eyes to her whole head. She thought, after seeing Chrom’s reaction, she could prepare herself for the pain. She hadn’t expected anything like this, though.

After about a minute, the pain subsided. Robin shook her head, then opened her eyes. She almost immediately felt dizzy, as she could see in all directions; in front of her, to her sides, behind her, even above her.

“I’ve also got eyes on my temples,” Robin said, opening her temple eyes. She’d found that opening her eyes at this slower pace was allowing her to acclimate to her wider field of vision much easier. She continued feeling the sides of her head, but felt no more eyes, so she reached around with her left hand, and felt a single eye in the back of her head. “Both intangibility and possession are valid hypotheses, given the powers ghosts and other spirits use in fiction,” said Miriel’s left head.

“And the best way to test which, if any, of these hypotheses is correct is by experimentation,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Yeah, I know,” said Chrom as he opened the tome. While he was still not very magically inclined, he was growing more confident in using tomes like this, so he quickly read the incantation, casting the spell. Chrom’s body glowed white as the tome worked its magic on him.

Chrom is unable to become tangible again.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Once the glow faded, though, there was no sign of any changes to Chrom, at least at first. A few seconds after the glow had faded, Chrom’s clothes began to fall, not off his body, but through him. There was a soft thud as the tome passed through his hands and hit the floor, and his clothes fell through Chrom’s body and piled up on the ground through his feet. Chrom’s sword, the Falchion, was the last piece of Chrom’s clothing to fall off, and it hit the ground with a clatter.

“What the...?” said Chrom, looking down at his naked body, and the clothes that had piled up through his feet.

“Gyah!” said Lissa from both her bodies as she blushed and looked away from her naked brother. Maribelle and Anna also averted their eyes, but Robin and Miriel continued to observe Chrom.

Chrom knelt down, and tried to pick up Falchion. However, his hand simply passed through the hilt.

“Huh,” said Chrom. “So, the tome made me intangible.”

“That could be really useful in battle,” said Robin as she walked up to Chrom and waved her hand through his head. “In fact, if you could use the invisibility and the intangibility tomes at the same time, you could make the perfect scout.”

“I find it odd that you have not passed through the floor,” said Miriel’s left head.

“At least part of your feet must still be tangible, in order to prevent you from passing into the floor,” Miriel’s right head continued.

“Theoretically, you should be able to control your intangibility,” Miriel’s left head finished.

“Yeah, you might be right,” said Chrom as he walked a few steps to one side, so he was no longer standing in the pile of his clothes. “Though if this is like the invisibility tome, I think this is my natural state now.”

Chrom closed his eyes and concentrated, taking slow breaths as he focused.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Chrom becomes intangible.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
After a few seconds, Chrom opened his eyes, and reached out to pick up the Falchion again. This time, his hand wrapped around the hilt, and he was able to lift the sword.

“You were right, I can control it,” said Chrom. “But I get the feeling that if I lose focus, I’ll become intangible again.”

“I see,” said Miriel’s right head, as she wrote down her observations in the notebook.

Now that he could interact with the world again, Chrom began picking up his clothes and putting them back on.

“Okay, I’m fully dressed,” said Chrom, once he had his clothes back on. “Lissa, can you restore me?”

“Sure,” said Lissa, opening her eyes. Her War Cleric body stepped forward and used the restoration staff, reversing the effect of the tome.

“That’s much better,” said Chrom, adjusting his clothes slightly.

“Don’t forget, you’ve got three tomes to go,” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“And I think that was the third use of this staff, meaning we’ve got seven uses left,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Yeah, I’m definitely going to need more of those staves,” said Anna quietly.

Chrom looked over at the three remaining tomes, a light blue one on the left, a yellow one in the middle, and a red one in the centre. Which tome did Chrom pick?
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Chrom is able to become tangible again.

choices: Chrom gains the ability to melt into a puddle.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Chrom picked up the first tome, the one with the light blue cover. The insignia on the front cover appeared to be some sort of uneven blob, which gave Chrom no hints as to what the tome might do.

“What’s the description for the light blue tome?” asked Chrom.

“Go with the flow,” said Miriel’s left head, which was looking at Chrom while she read from the notebook with her right head.

“That’s doesn’t give me any hints,” said Chrom. “Guess I’ll just have to try it and see what it does.”

Chrom cast the spell, causing orange words to spiral around him as his body once again flashed with white light.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: The light blue tome.

Chrom can only partially reform himself.
Chrom is unable to reform himself.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
The light quickly faded, and once again, there didn’t seem to be any obvious changes to Chrom’s body. However, Robin quickly noticed that Chrom seemed to be sweating profusely all of a sudden.

“Are you okay, Chrom?” she asked. “You look like you’re sweating really badly.”

“I feel fine,” said Chrom. “And I don’t feel like I’m sweating.”

Chrom rubbed his right hand against his forehead to see if Robin’s claims of his sweating were true. However, when he removed his hand, his fingers left smear marks in his forehead, and his hand was covered in a strange flesh-coloured liquid.

“Okay,” said Chrom slowly, his eyes wide as he watched the flesh-coloured liquid dripping from his hand and onto the floor.

Hesitantly, Robin reached out and poked Chrom’s right arm. Her finger sunk into his flesh, and when she pulled it out, her finger was covered in the flesh-coloured liquid as well.

“Go with the flow,” said Robin as she rubbed the flesh-coloured liquid between her fingers. “I think that light blue tome turns the user into some sort of liquid.”

“Fascinating,” said Miriel’s right head.

“And if the other tomes are any indication, Chrom should have the ability to control his new liquid form,” said Miriel’s left head.

“I see,” said Chrom. The ‘sweat’ running down Chrom’s face and arm was starting to drip off, causing small puddles of flesh-coloured liquid to form on the floor.

“So, what would happen if I do... this!” said Lissa with her War Cleric body as her Sage body walked up behind Chrom. As she finished speaking with her War Cleric body, she used her Sage body to shove Chrom, knocking him over.

“Whoa!” said Chrom as he fell over, and he hit the ground with a splat. His body flowed out of his clothes, turning Chrom into a large, featureless puddle that spread across the ground as Lissa began laughing.

“Lissa!” said Maribelle, looking at the puddle of Chrom in horror.

“Oh, relax, he’ll be fine,” said Lissa with her Sage body.

“It’s not like the tomes have hurt anyone,” her War Cleric body continued.

“He’s already starting to pull himself together,” she concluded with her Sage body, pointing at the puddle of Chrom.

Sure enough, the outer edges of the puddle were starting to contract as Chrom pulled them into himself, and Chrom moved his puddle form out of his pile of clothes.

“Chrom? Can you hear me?” said Robin as she knelt down. “Move towards me if you can.”

Chrom hesitated for a second, then began slowly pulling himself in Robin’s general direction.

“That’s it,” said Robin, placing her hand on the ground. “I’m over here.”

The more Robin spoke, the more Chrom seemed to get a better idea of where she was, as he started pulling his puddle form towards her faster, until he brushed up against her hand. Once Chrom was touching Robin’s hand, some of the puddle of Chrom started wrapping around Robin’s fingers.

“Yeah, it’s me,” said Robin, gently squeezing the flesh-coloured liquid in her hand. “Squeeze my hand if you can hear me.”

Chrom tightened himself around Robin’s hand, then relaxed again.

“Okay, so you can hear,” said Robin. “Can you see? Squeeze again if you can.”

This time, Chrom remained fluid, still leaving part of his puddle body in Robin’s hand.

“So, you can’t see when you’re a puddle, but you can hear,” said Robin.

“Interesting,” said Miriel quietly from both heads. She was watching Chrom’s puddle body with her left head, while she looked down at the notebook she was writing in with her right head.

“Do you think you can get yourself back into your normal form?” Robin asked.

A ripple spread across the puddle of Chrom, and the liquid Chrom in Robin’s hand tightened slightly, before relaxing and slipping out of her hand and into the puddle. The others watched, waiting to see of Chrom could reform himself.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Chrom gains the ability to melt into a puddle.

choices: Miriel does not buy the melting tome.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
After a few seconds, a small line appeared on the puddle of Chrom, which opened to reveal Chrom had managed to form one of his eyes. Chrom’s eye looked around briefly, then started sliding all over his puddle body. Chrom managed to form his other eye, and slowly began moving them in different directions over his body. However, he soon seemed to get dizzy doing so, and he pulled his eyes together and turned them so that they were both facing in roughly the same direction. Another line formed, and Chrom opened his mouth with a groan.

“Well, this is weird,” he said, his words sounding slightly slurred, due to the fact that his lips kept sticking together.

“How are you feeling?” Robin asked as she stood up.

“Not sure,” said Chrom as his nose began to form. “It doesn’t hurt but... it’s really hard to describe.”

“I can imagine,” said Robin. “Looks like you’re starting to get the hang of it.”

“Yeah, maybe,” said Chrom as part of the blob began to rise up, forming a roughly spherical shape. Chrom slid his eyes, nose and mouth along his body and up the side of his newly-formed head, then moved his face around so it was on the front of his face. Liquid began pooling over his head, forming a rough blob that mostly resembled the shape of his hair, though Chrom was unable to actually form hair yet. Chrom’s head began to rise as his neck began to take shape, followed by his torso. Long tendrils of flesh-coloured liquid began to stretch out from his shoulders, forming rough, almost boneless versions of his arms, though he didn’t manage to get fingers yet. Chrom was still for a few seconds, with liquid slowly running down and dripping off the parts of his body he had managed to form so far.

“Okay, I think that’s as good as I can do,” said Chrom, shrugging his shoulders, sending a ripple through his body. “At least for now. I think I’m going to need more practice.”

“Hey, it’s better than you were a few minutes ago,” said Robin.

“Yeah,” said Chrom, nodding his head distractedly as his upper body seemed to float in the puddle that consisted of his lower body and legs. Chrom began to move his puddle half around as his upper body started to become a little more solid, though he was still obviously liquid, and was still unable to properly form his hands or his hair.

“Your new method of locomotion is interesting,” said Miriel with her left head.

“I am somewhat interested in testing it firsthand,” said Miriel’s right head softly.

“Well, if you want to give the melting tome a go, I can sell it to you for five hundred gold,” said Anna, resting her finger on her chin as she smiled at Miriel.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Chrom can only partially reform himself.

choices: Miriel uses the melting tome now.
Miriel decides to use the melting tome later.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
“Very well,” her left head said. “I shall purchase the tome.”

Miriel picked up her bag, which Lissa had brought into the storeroom with her Sage body when she had returned from finding Chrom and Robin. She took out her purse, and quickly counted out the necessary gold.

“I believe this should suffice,” said Miriel with her right head as she held out the stack of coins.

Anna nodded, and took the coins from Miriel and gave her the melting tome. “Pleasure doing business with you,” said Anna. “Are you planning on using that tome now, or did you want to wait?”

Miriel paused again to think, and found her gazes wandering over to Chrom, who was still an upper body sitting in a puddle that consisted of his lower body and legs. After a few seconds of deliberation, Miriel reached a decision.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Miriel buys the melting tome.

Miriel can only partially reform herself.
Miriel is unable to reform herself.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
To answer Anna’s question, Miriel opened the melting tome and cast the spell, saying the incantation with both her mouths. Orange words spiralled around her as her body briefly flashed white. Once the white light faded, Miriel carefully set the tome down as she felt a strange wetness on her skin.

“I believe that answers your question,” said Miriel with her left head. She could feel herself starting to drip on the floor as her body finished becoming liquid.

“You really didn’t waste any time, huh?” asked Chrom, who was still only semi-solid.

Miriel didn’t answer Chrom’s question, as she was too busy adjusting to the new sensations of her fluid body. She closed her eyes, and relaxed, feeling her body start to flow out of her clothes. The dripping fluid from her arms became a downpour as she flowed downwards, spreading herself over the ground. Miriel could feel her liquid being absorbed into her clothes, but with a bit of concentration, she was able to pull herself out of her clothes, leaving her clothes dry as she formed a puddle. Miriel flowed out of her boots, unable to tell exactly where she was. She could no longer feel her clothes, and could instead feel only the wooden floor below her. Again, she could feel herself seeping into the wood, but with a bit of concentration, Miriel was able to keep herself out of the wood. With a little more focus, Miriel was able to reform all four of her eyes, and oriented them around her puddle so she could see in all directions. Once her vision was formed, she began moving around the floor, flowing around as she experimented with her new form. She pulled herself into as small a puddle as she could, then stretched herself out as far as she could.

“Wow,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body

“You’re getting the hang of this a lot faster than my brother,” Lissa said with her Sage body.

Miriel imagined her body growing a mouth, and she could feel both pairs of lips forming on the top of her puddle.

“Perhaps it is my experience with two heads that has allowed me to adapt so fast,” Miriel said with one mouth as she slid one of her eyes around to look at Lissa’s bodies.

“Or, I simply have a natural affinity for this form,” Miriel finished with her other mouth.

“Do you think you’ll be able to reform yourself?” Chrom asked. “Maybe you’ll have better luck than me.”
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Miriel uses the melting tome now.

choices: Chrom doesn't want to be restored.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Miriel contracted herself into as small a puddle as she could, then slid her eyes and mouths around in order to form her two faces. Once her eyes and mouths were in the correct places, Miriel focused on forming her noses. Two small bumps rose out of the puddle, and the two bumps took the shapes of her noses. Once her noses were formed, Miriel moved on to forming her heads. Two blobs began rising from the puddle, and Miriel moved her faces onto the fronts of the blobs. The two blobs continued to rise up from the puddle, and took a more solid shape. Ears began to form on the sides of the blobs as they became more defined, looking more and more like heads with each passing second. Soon, Miriel had completely reformed her heads, but both her heads were hairless, with not even eyelashes or eyebrows. Miriel closed all four of her eyes, and focused on forming her eyelashes. She felt a prickling sensation on her eyelids, then opened her eyes. Miriel raised a tentacle of fluid out of her puddle and felt along her eyes, and felt eyelashes under her tentacle. Miriel relaxed the tentacle, causing it to liquefy and slide back into her puddle. Now that she had confirmed that it was possible to reform hair, Miriel focused on forming her eyebrows. She felt the same prickling sensation on both her foreheads as short red hairs began poking out, quickly forming into her eyebrows. The prickling sensation ran across the tops of her heads as she began forming her hair, and Miriel could feel her hair brushing against her puddle as it formed.

“Wow,” said Lissa quietly, speaking with both bodies as she watched in awe.

“You’re already doing better than me,” said Chrom, who had moved away from Miriel, so that his puddle body wouldn’t mix with Miriel’s. “I still haven’t been able to form hair.”

“I must admit, it is somewhat surprising that I have been able to adapt to this form so quickly,” said Miriel with her left head.

“I believe my hypothesis about having a natural affinity for this form is valid,” she concluded with her right head.

“Do you think you can reform the rest of your body as well?” Anna asked.

“I will do my best,” said Miriel, speaking with her left head as she nodded with her right head.

Miriel’s head began rising out of the puddle as her neck’s form, and more of the puddle rose as her shoulders formed as well. However, rather than form arms, Miriel focused on creating her body. The puddle continued to rise until the rough shape of Miriel’s hips had emerged, then the blob started to take a more solid shape. The shoulders became wider and more defined, and the sides of the blob tucked in, following the curve of Miriel’s waist. Miriel’s breasts formed on the front of her chest, followed by her belly button. Once Miriel was satisfied with her body, she began pulling her fluids up the sides of her body and pushing it out from her shoulders. The fluid flowed down from her shoulders, slowly forming her upper arms. Once Miriel’s upper arms had finished forming, she pulled more fluid up her body and pushed it down her upper arms, forming her lower arms, then her hands. Miriel focused on forming her hands, and slowly, four fingers and a thumb emerged from the blobs at the ends of her arms. The blobs themselves soon formed into the palms of her hands.

“I’ve got to say, this is pretty interesting to watch,” said Robin as Miriel formed her hands.

“Yes, I have found that reforming myself like this is quite enjoyable,” said Miriel with her right head.

“You’ve still got to do your legs,” said Lissa with her War Cleric body.

“Chrom still hasn’t managed to do that,” she finished with her Sage body.

Miriel nodded her heads, then turned her attention back to reforming herself. Her body was currently resting in the puddle that was formed from her legs, and it rose up slightly as she finished reforming her hips. She began pushing herself up slightly as she began to form her thighs, then pulled her puddle apart into two distinct pools of liquid, one for her left leg and one for her right. Once she had done so, she pushed herself up and continued forming her thighs. With the experience she had from forming the rest of her body, her legs formed much faster than the rest of her had, and she shot up to what was almost her original height as her legs formed. However, she still had a puddle at the end of each leg that would form her feet. Miriel’s toes formed at the end of the puddles, and the puddles stretched out in the shape of her feet. The puddles rose slightly and stiffened as Miriel finished forming her feet.

“There,” said Miriel with her left head.

“I have restored myself to a solid form,” she continued with her right head.

“It would appear that going slowly and correctly forming each body part is the key to successfully solidifying,” she finished with her left head.

“I see,” said Chrom, who was slowly starting to sink back into a puddle again. “Well, considering the trouble the other tomes have given me, I doubt I’m going to make myself solid any time soon.”

“Speaking of which, are you truly solid, or have you just formed yourself into your old shape?” asked Maribelle as she walked up to Miriel. Maribelle poked Miriel’s naked shoulder, but Maribelle’s finger didn’t sink in like Robin’s had when she poked Chrom. Instead, Maribelle could feel solid bone in Miriel’s shoulder.

“It appears I have become truly solid,” said Miriel’s right head.

“I can feel that my skeleton has formed inside my body,” her left head continued.

“Huh,” said Chrom. “I still haven’t been able to form bones yet.”

“Here,” said Anna, walking up to Miriel. Anna was carrying a bundle of clothes in her arms, and she held the clothes out to Miriel. “You should probably get dressed.”

“Oh!” said Miriel from both heads as she began blushing profusely. “Of course.”

Miriel took her clothes from Anna, and began dressing herself. Miriel was able to put on most of her clothes with ease, though she had a bit of difficulty with her shirt, as she had not had to put a shirt on with two heads before. However, she quickly managed to get the correct heads through the correct holes, and soon finished dressing herself.

“That was a truly fascinating experience,” Miriel said with her left head as she put her glasses on. “I must write down my observations immediately.”

Once Miriel had her glasses on, she picked up the notebook she had been carrying, and began writing down the effects of the melting tome down, describing her experiences as a puddle and her experience with reforming herself into a solid form.

“Well, while she’s doing that, do you want to be restored?” Lissa asked with her Sage body as she walked towards Chrom with her War Cleric body, her War Cleric body holding the restoration staff in her hands.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Miriel is able to completely reform herself.

“That’s probably a good idea,” said Chrom as he started melting back into a puddle. “I still have to test the last two tomes.”

“Change your perspective?” asked Chrom. “Wonder what that could mean?”

He looked at the cover of the yellow tome in his hands. The cover showed a large stick figure, with a hole in the shape of a smaller stick figure inside of the larger stick figure’s body.

“Maybe it’ll give you the ability to grow really tall?” said Lissa, speaking with her War Cleric body.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Once the spell had been cast, Chrom’s body glowed white once more, and the glow soon faded away again. Once the glow had faded, there were no obvious changes to Chrom’s body.

“Well, I don’t see any changes,” said Lissa’s Sage body as she used both of her bodies to check Chrom for any changes brought about by the tome.

“Looks like another tome where the effect isn’t immediately obvious,” said Anna. “Though, given Chrom’s track record, he’ll probably lose control of his new power any second now.”

“I’d argue with you, except that you’re absolutely right,” said Chrom. “And I certainly don’t feel any different, either.”

“Hey, is it just me, or does Chrom seem to be a little shorter than he was before he used the tome?” Lissa’s War Cleric body asked.

“Hey, I think you’re right,” said Robin as she looked at Chrom. “He is shorter.”

As Robin spoke, Chrom’s clothes were becoming rather loose as he dropped in height. Normally, he was about a head taller than Lissa, but now he was the same height as her, and was getting smaller, though his shrinking stopped when he was about one head shorter than Lissa.

“So, this tome allows the user to change their height,” said Miriel with her left head as she made a note in the book she was carrying.

“I wonder if it allows the user to increase their height, as well as decrease it?” Miriel asked with her right head.

“I don’t know,” said Chrom with a shrug, causing the fabric of his now very loose shirt to billow. “I guess I’ll find out.”

Chrom closed his eyes, and focused on growing. He soon started to increase in height, rapidly shooting up to his normal height, then he started growing taller, causing his clothes to grow tight on his body. Once the tightness became painful, he opened his eyes and stopped growing.

“Well, it looks like I can grow, too,” said Chrom, looking down at the others. He then closed his eyes and concentrated again, and soon returned to his normal height.

“Fascinating,” said Miriel’s left head.

“I wonder what the maximum and minimum heights for the tome’s size changing abilities are?” she continued with her right head.

“I’m not sure I want to find out,” said Chrom. “What if become too small to see? Or if I grow so large I break through the roof? Besides, we still need to test the last tome.”

“I suppose further experimentation can be conducted at a later date,” said Miriel’s right head, as a bead of what looked like sweat rolled down the side of her right head’s left temple. Miriel frowned slightly with her right head, and the bead of sweat rolled back up the side of her head.

“I am having a little difficulty in remaining solid,” said Miriel’s left head.

“But it is nothing to concern yourself with,” Miriel’s right head continued.

“With practice, I am sure it will not be a problem,” she concluded with her left head.

“Alright, if you say so,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. She raised the staff in her hands, and the pink gem flashed, bathing Chrom in light. Once the pink light had faded, Chrom walked over to the last of the tomes, and picked it up.

What was the description for the red tome?

Once the glow faded, there was once again no sign that Chrom had been altered by the tome.

“It’s no fun when the changes aren’t obvious,” said Lissa with her War Cleric body. While her War Cleric body was speaking, her Sage body sighed and walked over to Chrom.

“I’m sure it’ll become obvious soon enough,” said Chrom as Lissa’s Sage body walked up behind him and started poking him. 1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
“Ah, what the hell,” said Sully. “I’ll give one of these things a go.”

“Great!” said Anna, pulling out a piece of paper. “Here’s a list of what each of these things can do. Just remember that I only brought one of each potion and tome, so for now, you can only pick one.”

“Yeah, that sounds fair,” said Sully as she read the list. Sully was quiet for a few minutes as she read through the list, and she looked back and forth between the list and the potions and tomes on the table a few times.

“Okay,” said Sully, once she’d finished reading. “I know what I’m gonna try.”

Sully placed the piece of paper on the table, then reached out and picked out one of Anna’s samples.

What did Sully choose?
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Sully.

choices: Someone else wants to try something.
Someone else arrives at the dining hall...
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Sully picked up a potion bottle. The glass bottle was red, and the liquid inside was bright green.

“This is the potion that’ll turn my feet into hooves, right?” Sully asked.

“Yeah, that’s right,” said Anna. “Just be careful, the potion transformations are pretty painful.”

“Hey, no pain, no gain,” said Sully as she stood up and uncorked the bottle. Sully leaned her head back and tilted the bottle up, pouring the potion into her mouth. Sully quickly drank it all, then took a few steps back from the table.

“How long does it take before... agh!” Sully began, then cried out in pain as the potion kicked in. Pain flared up in Sully’s feet, and quickly moved up her legs. Sully started standing on her toes as her foot started to grow longer, splitting her metal boots open. Sully’s upper legs shortened slightly, and her lower legs became a lot shorter as her ankle was raised up by her elongating foot. Sully’s toes were hidden behind her toenails, which grew and fused together, forming hooves.

Sully gasped as the pain in her legs began to subside, and she looked down at her legs.

“Whoa,” said Sully as she leaned over and began running a hand up and down her leg. She slowly lifted her left foot up, then lowered it back to the ground again, hearing her new hoof tapping on the floor. She did the same with her right foot, then took a few slow steps with her new hooves as a grin started to form on her face.

“Hot damn!” said Sully as she began to walk around with more confidence. “This is incredible!”

“Well, what do you know?” said Anna as she started smiling too. “Another happy customer.”

“So, what does having hooves feel like?” Stahl asked.

“Well, it’s a bit weird, but I think I’m getting the hang of it,” said Sully as she jumped up and down a few times. “I just gotta remember to walk on my toes, not my whole foot.”

“Really?” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“Yeah, that’s something not everyone realises,” said Sully as she knelt down to get a better look at her hooves. “See, the hooves are actually toes, and this part here is actually my foot,” Sully said as she ran her hand over the body parts in question. “This bit here, that looks like a backwards knee, is actually my ankle, and this part here is my lower legs.”

“Oh, okay,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. “That’s actually pretty cool.”

As Sully admired her new hooves, Anna picked up the grey tome on the table, and held it out to Sully.

“Here,” said Anna. “You can use this to turn what’s left of your boots into horseshoes.”

“Huh,” said Sully, looking at the remains of her boots, which had been ruined when her feet had transformed into hooves. “That’s pretty neat.”

Sully took the tome from Anna and opened it up. “I’m not really any good at magic, so I don’t know how well this will work.”

“Hey, if Chrom can use the tomes, you shouldn’t have a problem,” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“Fair enough,” Sully said with a laugh, then walked over to her ruined boots. Sully made sure she was standing inside her split boots, then read out the incantation inside the tome. Orange words, written in an ancient language, spiralled around her in circles as the spell was triggered. As the magic took hold, Sully’s pants and armour began to shift. Her shinguards split into two, forming a much shorter shinguard, as well as a footguard for her exposed feet. Ankleguards appeared on the backs of her feet, and Sully’s boots began shrinking under her feet, lining the bottoms of her hooves. Nails formed in the horseshoes, locking them into place.

“Wow,” said Sully as she lifted up one of her legs to get a better look at her new horseshoe. “That’s pretty darn impressive.”

“So, what do you think?” Anna asked.

“I have to say, I really like these new hooves,” said Sully, lowering her hoof back down to the ground. “I think I’ll stay like this.”

“That’s great,” said Anna. “I’m glad you like it.”

“Yeah, it’s really surprising how natural this feels,” said Sully as she walked back over to the table and sat down again. “It feels like I’ve had hooves for my whole life.”

“We’ve found that some people can adapt to their new forms faster than others,” said Miriel’s left head.

“You appear to be one of those who adapts faster,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Huh,” said Sully.

“Anyway,” said Anna. “Does anyone else want to try something?”

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Vaike grabbed a white potion bottle and uncorked it, then held it up to his lips and quickly drank the pale pink liquid.

“That was fast,” said Sully, tapping her left hoof idly.

“Yeah, I hope that was the right one,” said Vaike. “I wanted the four arms... owowowow!”

Vaike’s voice trailed off as the transformation began, and he felt a sharp spike of pain in his sides, just below his arms. Lumps of flesh formed under Vaike’s arms, then pushed out, slowly gaining form as muscles and bones took shape. As Vaike’s new pair of arms reached their full length, hands began to form, with the little fingers at the tops of Vaike’s new hands, and the thumbs at the bottom.

“Ow,” Vaike groaned. “You guys really weren’t kidding about the pain.”

“Yeah, it’s not fun,” said Lissa with her War Cleric body.

“And the pain feels the same, no matter which potion you try,” said Lissa’s Sage body, her tail swishing back and forth idly. “The only difference is where you feel the pain.”

“Anyway, it looks like you grabbed the right potion after all,” Stahl said, looking over at Vaike. “You’ve got four arms just like you wanted.”

“Heck yeah!” said Vaike, holding his four arms out in front of him. He raised his left arms, then lowered them and raised his right arms. He frowned slightly as he raised all four of his arms.

“Why are my new arms doing the same things as the old ones?” Vaike asked.

“You’re not used to having four arms yet,” said Anna. “Keep moving them around, and you should figure it out in a few minutes.”

“Oh, okay,” said Vaike as he continued moving his four arms up and down. “Yeah, that makes sense.”

Vaike continued to wave his arms around, and after a few minutes, he was able to raise his upper arms and keep his lower arms by his sides. Vaike then held his upper right and lower left arms out, and clapped his upper left and lower right hands together.

“Looks like your getting it,” said Sully.

“Hey, can I see your new hands?” Nowi asked as she put Maribelle’s head on the table. “They look like they’re upside down.”

“Sure thing,” said Vaike, folding his upper arms across his chest and holding out his lower arms for Nowi. Maribelle reached over the table and reclaimed her head while Nowi got a good look at Vaike’s new hands. In a sense, Nowi was right about Vaike’s new hands being upside down, as his fingers were arranged in the opposite way to the fingers on his old hands.

“So, you’ve got your pinkies where your thumbs should be,” said Nowi as she poked Vaike’s new hands. “Then you’ve got your ring fingers, your middle fingers, your pointer fingers and your thumbs. That’s so cool!”

“I know, right?” said Vaike, opening and closing his new hands a few times, then he unfolded his upper arms and held them over his lower arms. Vaike brought his upper left and lower left hands together, then brought his upper right and lower right hands together as well. First, he lined the fingers and thumbs of his upper and lower hands up, then he clasped his upper and lower hands together.

“This is so weird, but like, in a good way,” said Vaike. “It feels like I’m holding someone’s hands, but I’m actually holding my own hands. Whaddya think, Panne?”

“While I don’t feel entirely comfortable using these myself, I suppose I am glad you’re enjoying this, my mate,” said Panne, smiling slightly in her husband’s direction.

“Aw, thanks,” said Vaike as he sat down next to her, then took his wife’s right hand with both of his left hands. “Y’know, if you don’t like it, I can get Anna to restore me tomorrow.”

“I never said I disliked it,” said Panne. “It’s simply one of those strange things you man-spawn do that I don’t understand.” She smiled. “Besides, I’m sure I can find advantages to having a four-armed mate.”

“Seriously?” said Vaike as he blushed. “Er, I mean, yeah, there are totally advantages to the Vaike’s new arms!”

“So, Sully’s got hooves, and Vaike has four arms,” said Anna as she picked up the list and ticked off the two potions that had been used thus far. “Anyone else want to try something? Maybe one of the tomes?”
