“Ooh! Ooh! Pick me! I wanna try a tome!” said Nowi, sticking her hand up.

“Okay,” said Anna, smiling as she handed Nowi the list.

“Are we sure this is a good idea?” Miriel’s left head asked.

“While we know these items are safe for humans, they might not be safe for manaketes or taguel,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Well, now’s a good time to find out,” said Nowi as she read through the list. “Now, let’s see... Ooh, this one looks interesting.”

“Which one?” asked Anna.

“The one that allows you to grow or shrink,” said Nowi. “I wanna try that one.”

“Are you sure?” said Anna. “We only tested that one long enough to see what it’ll do. We don’t know how big or how small you could become.”

“Even more reason for me to try it,” said Nowi as she picked up the yellow tome in question. “Okay, here goes.”

What happened when Nowi tried to cast the spell?

Nowi wants to know how small she can shrink.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
As Nowi read out the incantation, orange words spiralled around her as her body glowed brightly. Once the white light had faded, there were no immediate signs that anything was different about Nowi.

“That worked, right?” Nowi asked.

“It certainly looked like it,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Yeah, that sort of glow means that the spell worked,” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“Okay, so, how do I use this new growing and shrinking ability?” Nowi asked.

“Well, with the detachment tome, I’ve found that I simply have to will myself to detach, and it happens,” said Maribelle, demonstrating what she meant by pulling on her right hand with her left, causing her right hand to pop off her wrist.

“Likewise, I simply have to imagine myself becoming liquid, and it will happen,” said Miriel’s right head as a droplet of flesh-coloured liquid rolled down Miriel’s left nose. The drop fell onto the table, and Miriel placed her hand on the drop of herself, absorbing the droplet back into herself.

“Okay, so I simply have to imagine I’m getting bigger,” said Nowi, nodding. As she nodded, her body began growing larger, causing her clothes to start digging into her skin. “Ow! Why are my clothes so tight all of a sudden?”

“Because you’re growing taller,” said Anna.

“I am?” said Nowi as she stopped growing, and immediately started shrinking. “I hadn’t noticed.”

“Yeah, Chrom was like that, too,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Each time he tested a tome, he had trouble controlling his powers,” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“Hey, careful you don’t shrink too small!” Vaike called out as Nowi returned to her original size, then started getting smaller.

“Wait, now I’m shrinking?” said Nowi, as she stopped shrinking, leaving her clothes just a little bit too loose.

“Well, not anymore,” said Vaike, shrugging his upper shoulders.

“Ugh, how hard is it to control this power?” said Nowi as she grew slightly, returning to her original size.

“Don’t worry, it shouldn’t take too long,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Yeah, a few minutes after I had used the duplication tome, I was okay with two bodies,” Lissa’s Sage body continued.

“And now, after a few hours, I feel like I’ve had two bodies my whole life,” Lissa’s War Cleric body concluded.

“So, I just need to practice?” said Nowi.

“Yep,” Lissa said, speaking in unison with herselves.

“Okay,” said Nowi, taking a few deep breaths. “Grow...” Nowi said, and her body slowly started to increase in size, “...and shrink,” Nowi said, and she started growing smaller. “Grow... and shrink... shrink... and grow...”

Each time Nowi spoke, her body started to change size, getting larger when she said ‘Grow’, and getting smaller when she said ‘Shrink’.

“See, you’re getting it,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “Good job!”

“Thanks,” said Nowi, smiling. “Hey, do you know how big or small I can get?”

“No, we did not test the limits of this particular tome,” said Miriel’s left head.

“Chrom was worried about growing so large he broke the roof, or shrinking so small he couldn’t be seen,” Miriel explained with her right head.

“Well, now that I can control this, I think it’s time to find out,” said Nowi.

“Very well,” said Miriel with her left head, taking out a notebook. “How tall are you naturally?”

“About four feet and six inches tall,” said Nowi. “Haven’t had a growth spurt for at least a century.”

“I see,” said Miriel, making a note of Nowi’s original height. “Do you wish to find how large you can grow, or how small you can shrink?”

“No, they do not,” said Miriel with her left head.

“That doesn’t bother you?” asked Kellam, causing everyone to look at him. “What? I’ve been here the whole time.”

“Hey, I’m over a thousand years old, remember?” said Nowi with a cheeky grin. “It wouldn’t be the first time I’ve been naked in front of a crowd.”

“...Do I even want to know?” said Kellam.

Nowi took a deep breath, then her body started to get smaller and smaller, slowly at first, but picking up speed quickly.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Nowi’s body rapidly became smaller, and within seconds, she had shrunk to the point where she was no longer visible. There was simply a pile of clothes where Nowi had been sitting.

“Nowi?” Miriel asked. “Are you still present?”

“Yep! I’m still here!” Nowi called out, her voice muffled by the clothing that was hiding her from view. Nowi’s clothes began moving about as Nowi tried to get herself out of the pile of fabric.

“Hey, can someone pick up my cape for me?” Nowi asked after a few seconds. “At least, I think it’s my cape. It’s hard to tell at this size.”

“Sure, I’ll get it,” said Stahl as he reached over and gently picked up Nowi’s purple cape. As he slowly lifted the cape up, he could see a tiny Nowi sitting naked on the chair, looking up at him.

“Thanks,” said Nowi as Stahl lifted the cape up. “You’re so big now!”

“Actually, I think you’re pretty small now,” said Stahl as he placed Nowi’s cape on a spare seat.

“Eh, you’re big, I’m tiny,” said Nowi with a shrug. “Same thing from where I’m sitting.”

“Hey, Stahl, can you pick Nowi up?” asked Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“We can’t actually see her from over here,” Lissa explained with her Sage body.

“Sure, if that’s okay with you,” Stahl said, looking down at Nowi.

“Go for it!” said Nowi as she stood up. “I wanna be picked up!”

“Okay,” said Stahl, lowering his hand down to the chair Nowi was standing on. He placed his hand flat on the chair, with his palm facing up, and Nowi stepped up onto his hand and sat down in the middle of his palm. Once Nowi was seated in his hand, Stahl slowly lifted his hand up from the chair and placed it on the table. Nowi then stood up and jumped off Stahl’s hand and onto the table, where the others could see her.

“Aw, you’re so cute!” Lissa’s War Cleric body cooed.

“Thanks,” said Nowi, smiling as she walked across the table to Miriel, who had set her notebook down on the table. Miriel was watching her writing with her left head, while she used her right head to observe Nowi.

“You are much smaller than I expected you to be,” Miriel’s right head said, watching as Nowi walked up to her notebook and started reading Miriel’s notes.

“Thankfully, you did not shrink to the point where you became invisible to the naked eye,” Miriel’s left head said.

“Yeah, that would’ve been scary,” said Nowi. “So, any idea how small I am?”

“I believe we can find out,” said Miriel’s right head, as she reached into her bag and pulled out a wooden twelve-inch ruler and placed it on the desk.

“Please lie down next to the ruler, and I will measure you,” said Miriel’s left head.

“Sure,” said Nowi, lying down on the table next to the ruler. Once she was lying down, Miriel moved the ruler so that one end was at Nowi’s feet, and the other end reached past her head.

“It appears that you are now six inches tall,” said Miriel’s right head as she picked up the ruler and returned it to her bag.

“Wow,” said Nowi as she sat up. “I really am small.”

“Indeed,” said Miriel’s left head. Once Miriel had returned the ruler to her bag, she picked up her quill and made another note in her notebook. As Miriel was writing, Nowi stood up and walked to the centre of the table. Once she was in the middle of the table, she sat down again and started growing. In only a few seconds, Nowi shot back up to her normal height.

“Goodness,” said Maribelle. “That was very fast, Nowi.”

“Yeah, I’m pretty sure I’ve got the hang of this now,” said Nowi, now at her regular height, sitting cross-legged in the centre of the table. Once she finished growing, Nowi climbed off the table, still completely naked. “I really enjoyed being tiny, but I suppose I’d better see how big I can get.”

Nowi took a few steps away from the table, then took a few deep breaths and closed her eyes. She concentrated, and imagined herself growing larger, and her naked body soon began to increase in size.

How big did Nowi end up?
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Six inches tall.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
For a few seconds, Nowi shot up in size, and only stopped when her head bumped into the ceiling.

“Ow,” said Nowi, shrinking down by about a foot as she reached up and rubbed the top of her head.

“You okay?” Lissa’s Sage body asked as she looked up at Nowi.

“Yeah, I’m fine,” said Nowi. “Just wasn’t expecting to hit the roof so fast.”

“Is that the reason you stopped growing?” Miriel’s right head asked.

“Yeah, I didn’t want to break through the ceiling or something,” said Nowi. “I think I can get even bigger, though. How high is this room, anyway?”

“If I had to guess, I’d say it’s about ten feet high,” said Stahl.

“Okay, so I’m probably about nine feet tall right now,” said Nowi. “That’s pretty cool.”

Nowi, now towering over everyone, took a few steps away from the table and sat down on the floor. Even though she sitting on the ground, Nowi was still tall enough to look everyone in the eye while they were seated at the table they were gathered around.

“Time to get even bigger,” said Nowi as she began to grow again. Just like before, her body grew larger and larger for a few seconds, though this time, she stopped growing a few feet before she hit the roof.

“Okay, I think that’s about as far as I can grow,” said Nowi, looking down at the table. “You all look so tiny from up here.”

“Yeah, well, from down here, you look really big,” said Vaike, shrugging his upper shoulders. “So how big are you, anyway?”

“Well, I’m definitely bigger than ten feet tall,” said Nowi. “Maybe twenty, twenty-five feet tall?”

“I believe twenty-five feet is the more accurate estimate,” said Miriel’s left head, which was looking up at Nowi while she looked down at her notebook and wrote with her right head.

“That’s so cool,” said Nowi. “I can shrink down to six inches, or grow to twenty-five feet. Would that be the same for everyone, or would different people grow to different sizes?”

“I believe the maximum and minimum heights may be dependent on the user’s original height,” said Miriel’s right head.

“However, I believe that anyone else who used the size changing tome would grow or shrink to similar heights,” Miriel’s left head continued.

“Now that you have found the minimum and maximum heights, do you wish to return to your normal size?” Miriel’s right head asked in conclusion.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Twenty-five feet tall.

choices: The tome shrinks Nowi's clothes to fit her.
The tome doesn't work on Nowi's clothes.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
“Actually, I think I’d rather shrink back down again,” said Nowi. “I mean, being a giant is cool, but I really enjoyed being so tiny earlier.”

Once she finished speaking, Nowi began shrinking herself again, and within a few seconds, she was back to her normal height. She stood up, and walked back towards the table the other Shepherds were sitting at, slowly shrinking herself with every step she took. By the time she reached the table, she was about three feet tall, as opposed to her regular height of four feet and six inches. Nowi then jumped up and sat on the table, then shrank herself back down to six inches tall.

“I wouldn’t have thought you’d enjoy being so small,” said Maribelle. “Then again, I never thought I’d enjoy being able to detach my body parts.”

“I know what you mean,” said Sully. “I didn’t expect having hooves instead of feet to feel so... natural, I guess.”

“I think that might have something to do with fact that all of this should be impossible,” said Anna. “We never knew how much we might enjoy doing this sort of thing, because before now, we’d have never been able to do it.”

“That idea may have some merit,” said Miriel’s left head.

“Now that I have two heads, I have found myself wondering how I ever used to manage with just one,” Miriel continued with her right head.

“However, I do not believe that holds true for every transformation,” said Miriel with her left head.

“For example, despite my natural affinity for the melting tome, and my enjoyment of the ability,” said Miriel’s right head, melting and reforming one of her hands to prove her point, “It does not feel as vital to my life as having two heads.”

“Yeah, I felt kinda the same about having two bodies,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“When I had the restoration staff used on me and lost this body, I felt absolutely awful,” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“Even though I’d only had my second body for less than an hour, it felt so much more natural than having just one body,” Lissa’s War Cleric body said. “I mean, yeah, it was a little disorienting at first, but it never felt wrong.”

“It... it almost felt like I was meant to have two bodies,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “Going back to a single body...” Lissa’s voice trailed off as a shiver ran down her spines.

“Just the thought of that makes me feel ill,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Lissa, I had no idea you felt that way,” said Maribelle. She reached her hands out, and held onto the right hand of Lissa’s War Cleric body with her left hand, and took the left hand of Lissa’s Sage body in her right hand. “If I’d known it would make you feel so terrible, I never would have used the restoration staff on you.”

“It’s okay, Maribelle,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “You didn’t know, and I don’t think I really knew either.”

Lissa leaned her bodies in towards Maribelle, and kissed Maribelle on both cheeks simultaneously, causing Maribelle to blush profusely.

“So, anyway,” said Nowi, speaking up into the slightly awkward silence that followed. “I’m still naked, but I don’t want to grow back to my original size. Do you think that tome that changed Sully’s boots into horseshoes can shrink my clothes too?”

“That’s a good question,” said Anna as she picked up the tome in question. “We’ve only used this on people that have used a potion, not people who’ve used a tome.”

“Well then, let’s find out!” said Nowi, standing up and walking into the centre of the table. “Can you get my clothes for me?”

“Sure thing,” said Anna, picking up Nowi’s clothes and placing them on the table. Once she’d set down Nowi’s clothes, Anna placed the clothing alteration tome on top the pile and opened it. Nowi climbed over her clothes until she reached the open tome, and made sure she was standing on the pile of clothing while she read out the spell.
1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.title: Nowi chooses to shrink back down again.

choices: Nowi's clothes grow bigger as she grows larger.
Nowi's clothes remain the same size as she grows.

“And, you know that the transformations caused by the potions are pretty painful, right?” Anna said as she picked up a pink bottle that contained a light purple potion. “Are you sure you want to try this?”

Sumia hesitated for a second, then nodded. “Yes, I’m sure.”

“Alright then,” said Anna as she walked back over to Sumia and held out the potion. “Here you go.”

“Thanks,” said Sumia. She pulled the stopper out, then held the bottle up to her lips. She carefully drank the entire potion, then placed the empty bottle back on the table.

“Don’t worry,” said Anna, resting a hand on Sumia’s shoulder. “It’ll only be for about a minute.”

Sumia tried to nod, but it was too painful for her to move her head. But, just like Anna said, after about a minute, the pain began to subside. Once the pain in her head was gone, Sumia lifted her head up, then opened her eyes, all nine of them. The expanded field of view immediately made Sumia feel dizzy, and she grabbed at the table to steady herself.

“Whoa,” said Sumia, as all of her eyes started looking around wildly, which wasn’t helping her dizziness.

“Just stay calm,” Robin said, and Sumia could see Robin behind her and to the right, sitting at another table. “Since you’re not used to having so many eyes, just try looking straight ahead.”

“O-okay,” said Sumia, as she tried to focus on just looking straight with each of her eyes. Her vision soon stabilised, allowing Sumia to better understand just how much she could see. Sumia could see in a full circle around her head, and could even see straight up. Her left and right fields of view seemed normal, but everything behind and above her seemed a bit flat.

“Okay,” Sumia said again, with a bit more confidence. Sumia blinked all of her eyes a few times, then slowly raised her hands and began feeling her head to find her new eyes.

“You should have an eye on each cheek, an eye on each temple, an eye in the centre of your forehead, an eye on top of your head, and an eye on the back of your head,” said Robin, and Sumia could see that Robin was speaking with her left lipple.

“Uh-huh,” said Sumia as she felt the places Robin had mentioned. “So, I’ve got... seven new eyes, right?”

“That’s right,” said Robin with her right lipple. “How do you feel?”

“I feel really weird,” said Sumia, as she looked to her left with all of her eyes, then looked to her right. “And some of my hair is getting in the way of my new eyes.”

Sumia reached up and pulled the locks of hair on the side of her head back, moving her hair out of the way of her cheek and temple eyes. She then reached around to the back of her head and parted her hair away from her back eye.

“I think I might be getting the hang of this,” said Sumia. “But my vision still seems a bit weird.”

“How so?” Miriel’s left head asked.

“Well, everything to my left and right seems normal,” said Sumia. “But everything in front of me seems a bit sharper, and everything behind and above me looks a bit flat.”

“I see,” said Miriel with her right head. “The flatness of your upper and rear vision may be due to a lack of depth perception.”

“With only a single eye in those locations, it may be difficult to judge how far away something is if it is behind or above you,” Miriel’s left head continued.

“Conversely, the eye in your forehead may be enhancing your forward depth perception,” Miriel’s right head concluded.

“Okay,” said Sumia, nodding slightly. “So, because I have two eyes on the sides of my head, does that mean I have depth perception to my left and right sides, too?”

“That is a reasonable assumption, yes,” said Miriel’s left head.

“So, how are you feeling?” Anna asked.

“I... I’m not sure,” said Sumia. “I can’t decide if I want to keep these new eyes or not...”

“Well, I do have a restoration staff available, if you really don’t want to keep the new eyes,” said Anna. “It will cost you two hundred gold to use it, though.”

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
With dinner over, Miriel returned to her quarters. On her way back, she picked up a large wooden bucket from a nearby storeroom, and carried it back to her quarters. When she entered her room, she set the bucket down next to her bed, then walked over to her desk. Miriel sat down as she opened up her notebook, and began reading through the information she had written down. It was still hard to believe what she had seen and experienced, even now. The strange potions and tomes Anna had received were capable of incredible feats of magic. However, thus far, Miriel had only observed the effects of the potions and tomes. She still had no idea how the magic in the potions and tomes worked, but she was eager to find out.

Miriel slowly read through the notes she had written, using both of her heads to read her writing. Her first notes were about how Miriel had adjusted to having two heads, followed by how Lissa and Anna had adjusted to their own changes. Next was Maribelle’s experiences, followed by what she had learned when Chrom and Robin were testing the remaining potions and tomes. The final section consisted of what she had learned by observing the other Shepherds when they had tried the samples Anna had brought.

As she went through her notes, Miriel opened a second notebook. Using her left head to read from the first notebook, Miriel used her right head to watch her writing as she noted down the current forms and alterations that had been made. Miriel herself had two heads, and the ability to melt herself into a liquid form. Lissa had created a duplicate body for herself, and had promoted her original body to War Cleric while her duplicate body was now a Sage. Additionally, Lissa’s original body had altered hands, with thumbs replacing her little fingers, and her Sage body now had a horse’s tail and the ability to detach body parts. Anna had been transformed into what Lissa had dubbed a ‘humantaur’, with a second pair of hips and legs having grown out of her rear. Maribelle had the ability to detach and reattach her body parts at will. Chrom had the ability to swap something between himself and another person. Robin had the ability to elongate and bend seemingly any part of her body, and she had also turned her nipples into mouths, which Lissa had recently dubbed ‘lipples’. Sully now had hooves in place of her feet. Vaike had grown a second pair of arms. Nowi had gained the ability to grow and shrink, and appeared to prefer being at her minimum height of six inches tall. Gaius had gained the ability to mimic the appearance, clothing and mannerisms of anyone he touched, and he had last been seen mimicking Tharja. Meanwhile, Tharja herself now had the ability to turn invisible, and had also rendered her clothing invisible, thanks to the clothing alteration tome. Sumia had seven additional eyes on her head, with one eye on each cheek, one on each temple, one in the centre of her forehead, one on top of her head, and one in the back of her head. Gregor had also become a humantaur, and Cordelia had also given herself a duplicate body. However, unlike Lissa, who claimed she felt more comfortable in two bodies, Cordelia seemed to struggle with having two bodies, and had returned to having a single body. However, Cordelia had also agreed to participate in further experiments, while Lissa had declined.

Despite running at a loss for most of the day, with the amount of inventory used for testing or given out as samples far outweighing the minimal income she had made, Anna actually considered the day to be quite profitable. Not only did she now know what her mystery products actually did, but many members of the Shepherds were now essentially walking advertisements for her store, showcasing an experience you couldn't get anywhere else in this realm. She'd yet to pen down a proper marketing strategy beyond that yet, though. She'd probably have to come up with something soon, before her sisters managed to discover her mystery supplier themselves.

Speaking of her sisters, the fact that she was no longer identical to the rest of her family continued to cross her mind as she headed back to her room in the barracks. She'd always grown up just being one of the many Annas across Ylisse, each just as easily mistaken for the rest. Now, there would be no mistaking her again. She wasn't just any old Anna, anyone would be able to tell at a glance that she was the Anna who belonged to the Shepherds. It almost made her a little excited, finally gaining some sense of individuality, and yet, it kind of felt like she was losing a little part of herself by standing out from her family like that. It was an altogether odd feeling, to say nothing of how the thing differentiating her felt.

The two sets of clicks her shoes made on the floor with each step she made rung in her ears, the halls mostly empty with the other Shepherds having returned to their rooms while she worked. She was now far from those first wobbly steps, unsure of how exactly she was supposed to walk with two extra legs. Now it felt incredibly natural, as if she'd had them her entire life. It was almost scary how quickly she'd adjusted. Unlike Lissa or Miriel, though very much like Chrom at first, she hadn't exactly taken well to her transformation to start with. She'd never really intended to become a test subject herself, only taking the potion at Lissa's urging, and she'd felt rather uncomfortable with her new form. In fact, the only reason she'd kept her humantaur form was to prevent Lissa from urging her to try something else. The longer she'd stayed like this, though, the more natural it began to feel, eventually reaching a point where she could scarcely imagine what it would be like to go back to just two legs.

She made a mental note to warn potential customers about that; if you don't like your form, restore yourself quickly or it'll start to feel natural. That wasn't to say she disliked her new humantaur body, though. She had already found a manner of uses for the extension of her torso, from carrying things in saddlebags to standing on her hind legs to reach up higher. It was strange, sure, but it was a useful sort of strange, and as of yet hadn't proved a hindrance beyond learning how to walk again.

She let out a yawn, stretching her arms up as she finally reached her room. She briefly glanced at her closet, thinking about all the unchanged pants that would no longer properly fit her. "...Tomorrow," Anna told herself, setting the clothing alteration tome she'd brought with her down upon her desk. Today had been a big day, and right now she just wanted to sleep. With that in mind, she began to strip.

Everything above the waist wasn't an issue, as obviously nothing had changed there. It was below the belt that was an issue. "Alright, you can do this Anna, it's just a pair of pants," she said to herself, sliding her boots off as she tried to figure out how she was going to get this altered garment off. Her pants had been changed to cover both pairs of legs, leaving her a little perplexed as to how to remove it. Ultimately, she decided to just take it one step at a time, and, with her rear hips seated on the bed, shimmied her front legs out of the pants as best she could. It wasn't exactly the easiest thing in the world, prompting Anna to briefly consider switching to skirts in future, but she managed to get it off and over her ankles.

"Oh... That's different," Anna mumbled, peering down at her front legs' crotch. In amongst all the new sensations of a second pair of legs, Anna had missed some of the smaller things. For instance, she didn't appear to be wearing underwear on her front legs. She couldn't even imagine how she'd get it on properly with her taurso in the way, but it seemed it wasn't necessary anymore, as that which her underwear was made to cover wasn't present. The space between her legs was blank. It was still present, of course, she just hadn't bothered to take notice that it now sat between her rear legs instead. "Guess I'll have to tell Miriel about that tomorrow."

Deciding the placement of her genitals were not more important than sleep, Anna continued her quest to get her pants off, slowly pulling it down her taurso, awkwardly reaching behind her to do so, before she was forced to stand for a moment to pull it over her rear, revealing where her underwear had gone. With Robin’s hand in his, Chrom felt the swapping power welling up inside him. All it took was a little focus, and he could feel his body shifting again as he undid the gender swap. Chrom felt his chest flatten, and watched as Robin’s breasts grew back in. Within seconds, the two of them were back to normal... or mostly normal, in Robin’s case.

“That feels better,” said Chrom once his body had stopped changing. “Being a woman was just... so weird.”

“You didn’t like it?” Robin asked, using her original mouth.

“I wouldn’t say that, exactly,” said Chrom. “I just couldn’t get used to it. I mean, I didn’t hate it, but it just didn’t feel right. You know?”

“Yeah, I guess that makes sense,” said Robin with her left lipple, then yawned with all three of her mouths again.

“Well, as much as I’d like to just stay in bed all day, I suppose we’d better get up,” said Chrom as he got out of bed.

“I know,” Robin said with her right lipple as she stood up.

After taking the time to freshen themselves up and put on clean clothing, Chrom and Robin were ready for the day ahead.

“Do you think we should join the other Shepherds for breakfast?” Robin asked with her right lipple as she and Chrom left their bedroom. “Or should we just eat here in the Palace?”

“I think we should join the others,” said Chrom. “That way we can see how everyone else is adjusting to their new bodies. Unless you’d rather eat now?”

“No, I can wait,” said Robin. “Besides, given how strange some of these changes are, I think it’s best that we make sure everyone’s adjusting properly.”

“Fair enough,” said Chrom, as he and Robin began walking through the halls.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
As Chrom and Robin walking through the Palace, they spotted two people coming towards them. However, it turned out those two people were actually one person, as both of Lissa’s bodies were walking down the hall. Lissa’s clothing was crumpled, and the hair on both her heads was a complete mess. Despite her untidiness, Lissa seemed to not have a care in the world. She was walking with a bounce in both her steps, as her War Cleric body hummed to herself and the horse-like tail of her Sage body was swishing back and forth happily.

“Morning, Chrom.” “Morning Robin.” Lissa said cheerfully, speaking with both bodies at once.

“Morning, Lissa,” said Chrom.

“You seem to be in a good mood this morning,” said Robin with her left lipple.

“Oh! Uh...” “Well, it’s just...” “I was, er...” “Um, y’know...” Lissa stammered with both mouths simultaneously, her voices trailing off into nervous gibberish as she started to blush.

“I see,” said Robin’s right lipple, as a smile tugged at all three of her mouths. “That was very eloquent, Lissa.”

“Sorry, I’m just...” Lissa’s War Cleric body began.

“I still kinda don’t believe it...” Lissa’s Sage body continued.

“Believe what?” asked Chrom. “What happened?”

“Nothing happened last night!” Lissa’s War Cleric body yelped as her faces went bright red, making it clear that something had indeed happened.

“It’s just...” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“I found out the person I love...” Lissa’s War Cleric body continued.

“Feels the same about me...” Lissa’s Sage body concluded, as she looked away dreamily with both pairs of eyes.

“Aw, that’s so sweet,” said Robin with her original mouth. “So, who’s the lucky man?”

“It, um... it wasn’t a man...” Lissa’s War Cleric body said nervously.

“It was... it was mrbll...” Lissa’s Sage body said, her voice dissolving into an unintelligible mumble as her blushes grew even brighter.

“Sorry, what was that?” Chrom asked.

“ItwasMaribelle!” Lissa said in unison with herselves, the words rushing together in her nervousness.

“I... I’m in love with Maribelle,” said Lissa with her War Cleric body, having calmed down a little.

“We’re, um, together,” she continued with her Sage body. “Romantically, I mean.”

“Really?” asked Robin with her left lipple.

“Uh-huh,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body, nodding.

“So, I’m guessing you spent the night in Maribelle’s room?” Robin asked with her right lipple. “Did you at least put her back together when you two were done?”

“Wuh, er, I-I don’t know wh-what you’re talking about,” Lissa’s Sage body stuttered as her blushes grew to encompass her faces.

“Sh-she was already in pieces when we, uh...” Lissa’s War Cleric body began, then her eyes went wide as she realised what she was saying.

“I-I mean, I had to help put her back together when we woke up...” said Lissa’s Sage body.

“B-but that was because she was already in pieces when we went to bed!” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“I mean, when she went to bed... oh gods, this is embarrassing,” Lissa’s Sage body said as she buried her face in her hands.

“Relax, Lissa, I’m just teasing,” said Robin with her left lipple.

“So, um, you’re okay with me seeing Maribelle?” Lissa asked with her War Cleric body.

“Of course we’re okay with it,” said Chrom. “Maribelle’s a lovely young woman. So long as you two make each other happy, I don’t see your relationship as causing any problems.”

“Whew,” Lissa’s Sage body sighed in relief. “I mean, I didn’t think you two would have a problem with it, but it’s nice to hear it out loud, you know?”

“Yeah, I know,” said Chrom, smiling. “You, uh, might want to tidy yourself up a bit before breakfast, though.”

“Huh?” said Lissa’s War Cleric body as she looked herselves over, checking her Sage body out with her War Cleric head and vice-versa.

“Oh. Yeah, I was on my way to do that when I ran into you two,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “I, uh, I should probably get back to my room.”

“Don’t worry, we won’t keep you any longer,” said Robin with her right lipple.

“We’re going to join the other Shepherds at the Barracks for breakfast,” said Chrom. “Care to join us?”

“Sure!” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. “Just give me a few minutes. I’ll join you in a bit.”

“Don’t worry, we’ll wait for you,” said Chrom, as Lissa began walking her two bodies down the hall towards her room.

Once Lissa had finished cleaning herselves up, she rejoined Chrom and Robin, and the three of them made their way to the Shepherds’ Barracks. Once they arrived at the Barracks, Chrom, Robin and Lissa made their way to the dining hall to join the other Shepherds for breakfast.

When they arrived, breakfast was already well underway, and all of the Shepherds were chatting with each other as they ate.

“Ooh, hey, there’s Maribelle,” said Lissa, speaking with her War Cleric body as she pointed with her Sage body. Lissa weaved her bodies through the crowd over to Maribelle, who was sitting at a table with Olivia, Panne and Vaike.

“Oh, hey Lissa,” said Vaike, waving at Lissa with his upper left hand as she approached.

“Morning, guys,” Lissa’s Sage body said. She sat her War Cleric body on Maribelle’s left, and sat her Sage body down on Maribelle’s right. Once she was seated, she leaned her bodies in and pecked Maribelle on the cheeks.

“Was that really necessary, darling?” Maribelle asked as she blushed slightly.

“Aw, but I missed you,” said Lissa with her War Cleric body as she pouted with her Sage body.

“You were gone for half an hour at most, my dear,” said Maribelle as she started to smile. “I’m sure you can survive that long without me.”

“I know,” Lissa’s Sage body said as she took Maribelle’s hands in her own. “I’m just... still so happy, you know?”

“I know, love,” said Maribelle. “I am too.”

“Uh, am I missing something?” said Vaike.

“I believe Maribelle and Lissa are together,” said Panne, causing Lissa and Maribelle to both look sheepish.

“But those two are always... oh, you mean romantically,” said Vaike.

“Yeah, that, um, that’s right,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body as she nodded sheepishly.

“Huh,” said Vaike. “Well, hey, congrats, you two.”

“Thank you,” said Maribelle. “I appreciate your support.”

“We both do,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. “It’s nice to see that everyone’s okay with, you know, us.”

“I don’t see why it would cause a fuss,” said Panne. “Love is love, regardless of gender.”

“I agree,” said Olivia. “So long as you’re happy together, that’s all that matters.”

“Thanks,” said Lissa with her Sage body.

“You’re welcome,” said Olivia. “Um... i-if you don’t mind, I had a question about the potions...”

“Sure, go ahead,” Lissa’s War Cleric body said.

“Well, um... w-what was it like when you, um, when you had three legs?” Olivia asked. “How did you actually walk like that?”

“I actually found it really easy,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “I just relaxed and did what came naturally. For me, that meant stepping forward with the two outer legs first, then stepping forward with the middle leg.”

“I see,” said Olivia. “So it was like two-one, two-one, instead of one-two-three, one-two-three.”

“Yeah, I guess so,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body. “I mean, maybe if I was running, I might go left leg, middle leg, right leg, but I only tried out walking, and I didn’t get very far.”

Olivia nodded. “And how hard was it to get used to having three legs?”

“Honestly, it wasn’t that hard for me,” Lissa said with her Sage body. “But that might have to do with the fact that I had already gotten used to having two bodies. Three legs was nothing compared to that.”

“Why are you so curious, anyway?” Lissa’s War Cleric body asked. “Were you thinking of trying the potion yourself?”

“Um, maybe?” said Olivia. “I mean, just think of all the dances I might be able to do with three legs... but then I’d have to adapt all my old routines for my new body, and everyone would be staring at my new leg, and using the potions is so painful...” Olivia sighed. “I just can’t decide...”

“Hey, there’s no rush,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “Anna still has plenty of potions and tomes you can buy.”

“And just because there’s plenty of people who have used ‘em, doesn’t mean you need to join in,” said Vaike. “You’re dances are great just the way they are.”

“Oh, stop it,” said Olivia as she blushed.

Meanwhile, Chrom and Robin had found a seat at the next table over, joining Miriel, Anna, Gregor and Cordelia. Miriel was sitting slightly lower than normal, as Miriel’s legs were currently liquid instead of solid. Gregor was still a humantaur, and Cordelia had only arrived with one body, though she had a spare set of clothes on the table next to her, just in case. Anna had also kept her humantaur body, but her eyes were surrounded by dark rings.

“Good morning,” Miriel said with her left head as Chrom and Robin sat down.

“Morning,” Robin replied with her original mouth as she sat down.

“Are you okay, Anna?” Robin asked with her left lipple.

Anna nodded, then covered her mouth as she yawned.

“‘m fine,” Anna said. “Just didn’t sleep well. I need to get a bigger bed.”

“Huh? Oh, because of your humantaur body,” said Chrom.

Anna nodded. “My taurso and back legs kept hanging out of the bed,” she said. “I’m also not used to sleeping on my side.”

“Yes, Gregor and Cordelia were having same problem,” said Gregor. “Cordelia could not be fitting in bed while Gregor was already lying down. Gregor and Cordelia had to be sleeping in different beds.”

“Not only that, but I was afraid I might duplicate myself in my sleep,” said Cordelia. “If that happened, my second body would’ve fallen out of the bed.”

“Yeah, that could be painful,” said Robin with her right lipple.

“Thankfully, Gregor helped me get used to having two bodies before we decided to go to bed,” said Cordelia. “As you can see, though, I still prefer only having one body.”

“Is that why you have the spare set of clothes?” Robin asked with her left lipple. “In case you accidentally duplicate yourself again?”

“Oh, no, I’ve got the hang of it now,” said Cordelia. “This is for when Gregor and I help Miriel out later.”

“Cordelia has agreed to assist me in determining how the duplication ability interacts with the body alteration potions,” Miriel said with her right head. “While we know that using a potion only affects the body that uses the potion, it is still unknown how reintegrating the two bodies affects the potions used.”

“Well, that sounds like it could be interesting,” said Chrom. “You’ll have to let us know how it goes later.”

“Of course,” said Miriel.

“I see you’ve found a new way of getting around,” said Robin with her original mouth.

“Indeed,” said Miriel with her left head.

“Unfortunately, it is not an efficient method of locomotion,” Miriel said with her right head.

“While I am capable of travelling at walking speed, I find that my puddle body tends to collect detritus as I move,” Miriel’s left head continued.

“While I can easily eject such matter, I will always end up collecting more,” Miriel’s right head continued.

“Not only that, but I risk getting larger objects stuck inside my fluid if I were to leave the interior of this building,” Miriel said with her left head.

“Thus, I have decided that I will save this method of locomotion for interior use, and will use my legs for exterior travel,” Miriel concluded with her right head.

“Huh,” said Anna. “Yeah, I never thought of that, but it makes sense.”

“Indeed,” said Miriel. “I also have to take care with how I dress. If I am not careful, the fabric of my clothing will absorb some of my fluid. While I can remove myself from the fabric, doing so is tedious.”

“So, how did you sleep?” Anna asked. “I mean, you would’ve soaked into the mattress, right?”

“I suspected that might happen, so I did not sleep in my bed last night,” said Miriel. “Instead, I acquired a bucket before I retired for the night. By liquefying myself within the confines of the bucket, I was able to sleep quite soundly.”

“Ooh, that’s actually a good idea,” said Anna. “I might give it a try.”

“You’d need to get used to the whole melting thing,” said Chrom. “I know Miriel adjusted to it pretty quickly, but I had some serious trouble with it yesterday.”

“Yeah, that’s a good point,” said Anna. “I’m still thinking it over.”

“Speaking of adjusting,” Robin said with her left lipple. “These potions and tomes could cause quite a stir.”

“We were getting some strange looks earlier,” said Robin’s right lipple.

“Yeah, I know,” said Chrom. “I might have to do a public address to explain the situation if things start getting out of hand.”

“Well, I certainly won’t say no to free advertising if you do,” said Anna, earning a laugh from Chrom.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Later that day, Anna was standing behind the counter at her shop, tracing her finger over the blob-like insignia on the light blue tome. After the Shepherds had finished breakfast, she’d made her way to her shop and began opening up. Anna hadn’t received any customers yet, and she was oddly thankful. She knew that her new appearance might be a little disconcerting to anyone who didn’t know about the potions and tomes, so she didn’t have to answer any odd questions or deal with someone panicking about her humantaur form. Besides, it gave her more time to try and develop some sort of marketing strategy, beyond it simply being an experience that couldn’t be found anywhere else. Maybe she should market each of the potions and tomes on an individual basis. After all, they all had unique effects, and as such, they all had unique benefits...

Anna was brought out of her musings by the sound of the doorbell ringing as someone entered. She looked up and saw Cordelia coming in, carrying a bundle of clothes in her arms.

“Good morning,” Cordelia said as she closed the door behind you.

Anna covered her mouth as she yawned. “Morning,” Anna said once she’d finished yawning.

“Is Miriel here yet?” Cordelia asked.

“No, not yet,” said Anna, shaking her head. “But she’ll probably be here soon.”

Cordelia nodded. “In that case, I’d better get ready.” She placed the bundle of clothes on the counter, then took a step back. “You may want to close your eyes.”

“Huh?” said Anna. “Oh, right.”

As Anna closed her eyes, Cordelia’s body began glowing brightly. Once the glow had faded, Anna opened her eyes to see two Cordelias, one fully dressed, and the other naked.

“So, you’ve gotten used to having two bodies now?” Anna asked.

“Yes, thankfully,” said the Cordelia standing on the left, which was the original.

“When I woke up this morning, it felt completely natural,” said the Cordelia on the right, the duplicate, as she dressed herself.

“Spending the night as two people was a lot more helpful than I thought it would be,” said the Cordelia on the left.

“Yeah, the more time you spend with something like this,” Anna said, gesturing at her taurso, “The easier it becomes to deal with.”

“That is true,” said the Cordelia on the right as she finished dressing herself.

“Is that the melting tome?” Cordelia’s original body asked.

“Yeah, I still can’t decide if I want to use it or not,” said Anna. “On the one hand, it sounds like it could really take some getting used to. On the other hand, sleeping in a bucket would be a lot easier than getting a new bed.”

“I know,” said Cordelia’s duplicate body, now fully dressed. “It took some time for Gregor and I to find a big enough bed to fit us both.”

“Since he’s a humantaur, and I have two bodies, we essentially need a bed that can hold four people,” said the Cordelia on the left.

“Thankfully, we managed to find one that was big enough,” said the Cordelia on the right. “Gregor stayed behind to finish setting it up.”

The doorbell rang again, and Cordelia turned both of her heads to see Miriel walking in.

“Hello,” Cordelia said with her original body.

“Greetings,” said Miriel, speaking with her left head.

“Are you prepared for this morning’s experiments?” Miriel’s right head asked.

“I am,” said the Cordelia on the left.

“Very well,” said Miriel’s left head.

“You two can head on into the back,” said Anna. “If you need anything, let me know.”

Miriel nodded her two heads, and headed into the storeroom behind Anna’s shop. Cordelia’s two bodies followed after her.

“So, what do we know about how the potions and tomes work with two bodies?” Cordelia’s duplicate body asked.

“Thanks to Lissa’s efforts yesterday, we know that using a potion or a tome only modifies the body that uses the potion or tome,” said Miriel with her right head.

“So, if I drank the potion that gave you two heads with my duplicate body, only my other body would get a second head, right?” Cordelia asked with her original body. “This body would still be normal?”

“That is correct,” said Miriel with her left head.

“However, since you discovered it is possible to return to having a single body, this opens up new questions,” Miriel continued with her right head.

“How does removing the duplicate body interact with the alterations made by the potions and tomes? That is what we are attempting to determine today,” Miriel concluded with her left head.

Cordelia nodded both her heads. “So, should we use the potions for this?” Her duplicate body asked. “I know the changes made by them are painful, but they are more obvious.”

“Agreed,” said Miriel. “And for our first experiment, I recommend you return to having a single body. I wish to see what occurs if you consume a potion with a single body, then duplicate yourself.”

“Alright,” said Cordelia with her original body. There was a bright flash, and when the light faded, Cordelia’s duplicate body had disappeared. The clothes the duplicate body had been wearing remained standing for a split second, then collapsed as gravity took hold.

“I’m ready,” said Cordelia, back to having only one body.

“The potions can drastically alter your body,” Miriel pointed out, speaking with her right head.

“It may be prudent to remove your clothing, so as not to damage it,” Miriel’s left head continued.

“That... is a good point, actually,” said Cordelia. She took a few moments to remove her clothing, though she chose to leave her underwear on.

“I think I’ll start with something that won’t cause a huge change to my body,” Cordelia said as she walked over to the potions. “Something like... this one.”

Cordelia reached into a box labelled ‘TAIL’, and pulled out a clear bottle that contained a black potion. She uncorked the bottle and held it to her lips, tilting it back and pouring the potion into her mouth. Cordelia swallowed, and set the bottle down. Her eyes went wide as she gasped in pain, and struggled to remain standing as the tail grew out from the base of her spine. Bright red hair began to form, trailing down to the ground as the horse-like hair formed over Cordelia’s tail.

Cordelia panted as the pain slowly began to subside.

“Ow,” Cordelia groaned as her tail began to swish from side to side. She looked over her shoulder at her tail as the red hair brushed against the back of her legs.

“Huh,” said Cordelia, wagging her new tail back and forth. “You know, I think I can see why Lissa likes having a tail.”

“Yes, but she only has a tail on her Sage body,” said Miriel with her right head.

“And we need to see if my duplicate will also have a tail or not,” said Cordelia.

“That is correct,” said Miriel with her left head. “If you would kindly duplicate yourself?”

Cordelia nodded, and closed her eyes to concentrate. There was a bright flash, and when the light faded...

Once it finished forming, Cordelia’s duplicate body was naked, as was to be expected. Not only that, but Miriel could see the long red hair dangling behind the legs of Cordelia’s duplicate body.

Cordelia turned her heads, so that her original body was looking at her duplicate, and vice versa.

“So, both of my bodies have a tail now,” said Cordelia’s original body. Her duplicate body took a small step forward as Cordelia walked her original body behind her duplicate body and knelt down to get a better look at her duplicate body’s tail.

“Fascinating,” said Miriel as she started writing in her notebook, watching Cordelia with her left head and her notebook with her right. “The duplicate appears to take whatever form the user’s original body has at the time of duplication.”

“That’s certainly what it looks like,” said Cordelia’s duplicate body, as her original body ran her fingers through her duplicate body’s tail. “Do you want me to go back to being a single person and try a different potion? That way we can make sure this isn’t a fluke.”

“While I appreciate your adherence to the scientific method, I do not believe that will be necessary,” said Miriel with her left head as she turned a page in her notebook. “Reading through my notes from yesterday, I believe I have discovered a precedent for this situation.”

“What do you mean?” Cordelia’s original body asked, stepping out from behind her naked duplicate.

“Yesterday, when Lissa first duplicated herself, she was still a Cleric,” Miriel’s right head said. “Using two Master Seals, she was able to promote her original body into a War Cleric, and her duplicate body into a Sage.”

“However, Lissa had a restoration staff used on her, losing her duplicate,” Miriel’s left head continued. “She then used the duplication tome a second time, regaining her duplicate.”

“But this time, her duplicate was a War Cleric, rather than being a Sage,” Miriel’s right head concluded. “Thus, it appears that the duplicate’s form is based on the user’s original form at the time the duplicate is created.”

“I see,” Cordelia’s duplicate body said. “So, we don’t need to repeat this experiment?”

“No, I believe I have sufficient data for now,” said Miriel’s left head. “If I require more information, we can repeat the experiment at a later date.”

“Okay,” said Cordelia with her original body. “So, did you have any other experiments you wished to test?”

“Yes, as a matter of fact, I do,” Miriel said with her right head as she flipped through her notebook. “I wish to see what happens if an alteration is made to the duplicate, and then the duplicate is dismissed.”

“And what do you hope to learn from this test?” Cordelia’s duplicate body asked.

“I wish to know if the changes made to the duplicate are added to the original body when the duplicate is no longer present,” said Miriel’s left head.

“If that is the case, will the changes then be removed from the original body and applied to the duplicate?” said Miriel’s right head.

“And if the changes are not applied to the original body, will the duplicate retain those changes when it is summoned again?” said Miriel’s left head.

“So, you want me to drink a potion with this body, then go back to having one body?” Cordelia’s duplicate body asked.

“That is correct,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Alright,” Cordelia said with her original body as she walked her naked duplicate body over to the boxes of potions. After a few seconds of deliberation, she reached into a box labelled ‘LIPPLES’. When she pulled her hand out, she was holding a clear bottle that contained a purple potion.

“Hopefully, this won’t be too hard to get used to,” Cordelia’s duplicate body said as she uncorked the potion bottle and held it to her lips. She quickly drank the potion, then put the bottle down before the transformation could begin. Cordelia’s bodies gasped in unison, and her hands clutched at her breasts as the pain began. Miriel watched in fascination as the nipples on Cordelia’s duplicate body slowly started to grow wider, forming large mouth-like shapes. A line appeared in the centre of the lumps on her breasts, slowly deepening as the lips formed. The newly formed mouths opened up, gasping for air in unison with Cordelia’s original mouth.

“Ow,” Cordelia’s original body said as her duplicate body opened and closed her mouths. “It was so weird, feeling that pain in only one body.”

“Yes, I believe Lissa mentioned something similar yesterday,” Miriel said with her left head. “Are you ready to proceed?”

“Huh?” said Cordelia’s duplicate body, speaking from all three mouths simultaneously. “Oh, sorry. I was just trying to figure out why something in my mouths tasted strange.”

“What do you mean?” Miriel’s right head asked.

“I’m not sure,” said Cordelia’s duplicate body, again speaking with all three mouths. She then reached up and held her jaw shut while she continued opening and closing her lipples.

“I might be wrong,” Cordelia’s duplicate said with both lipples. “But I think the saliva from my lipples might actually be breast milk.”

“Interesting,” said Miriel with her left head. “I will speak with Robin later, to see if she has experienced anything similar.”

“If that is true, it would allow your breasts to still function as breasts while your lipples are present,” Miriel’s right head said.

“Regardless, that is not actually the purpose of today’s experiment,” said Miriel’s left head. “If you could please go back to having a single body?”

“Alright,” said Cordelia with her original body as her tail waved slowly from side to side. “Let’s see if I get lipples on this body or not.”

There was a flash of bright white, and Cordelia’s duplicate body disappeared. With her duplicate gone, Cordelia reached up and took off her bra to better examine her breasts.

With her bra off, it immediately became obvious that Cordelia had gained the lipples that her duplicate body had previously had.

“Huh,” said Cordelia, speaking with her two lipples. “It looks like any changes that are made to my duplicate get added to my original body when the duplicate disappears.”

“So it would seem,” said Miriel with her right head.

“Incidentally, the potion transformations are quite painful,” said Miriel’s left head. “Did you feel any sort of pain or discomfort when you returned to having a single body?”

“No, not at all,” said Cordelia, speaking with her original mouth. “In fact, I didn’t realise I had these until I took my bra off.”

“Fascinating,” said Miriel with her right head.

“So, now what?” Cordelia asked with her lipples.

“I would like you to duplicate yourself again,” said Miriel, speaking with her left head. “I am curious to see what will happen.”

“What do you think might happen?” Cordelia asked with her original mouth.

“I believe there are two possibilities,” Miriel said with her right head. “The first is that both your duplicate and original bodies will now have lipples and a tail.”

“That makes sense,” said Cordelia’s left lipple.

“After all, my duplicate is the same as my original body when it’s summoned,” she continued with her right lipple.

“What’s the other possibility?” Cordelia asked with her original mouth.

“It is possible that, while your duplicate body may have lipples and a tail, your original body may only have a tail,” said Miriel’s left head.

“I see,” said Cordelia with her right lipple. “I didn’t think something like that might happen.”

“It is, perhaps, something of a remote possibility,” said Miriel’s right head. “Nevertheless, it is possible. And the only way to see if it might happen...”

"Thank you," Cordelia uttered quietly, the typically composed knight feeling a bit out of her element at the moment.

"Thanks," Anna called behind her.

"Returning to the topic at hand," Miriel stated, "Both Chrom and Lissa's suggestions appear to be equally likely. Cordelia, would you mind attempting to remove one of your bodies again?"

"Are you sure this is safe?" Cordelia asked, all three bodies still acting in unison. "What if the tome only lets me create more bodies and not remove them? What if I end up with four bodies?"

"Hey, it's up to you," Anna interjected before Miriel could say anything more. "If you don't want to try again, you don't have to. I've still got the restoration staff if you want the ability removed properly, although I'm afraid I will have to charge for that."

She could have her duplication ability removed with the restoration staff, but she had promised Gregor that they'd both use one of Anna's items, and she somewhat felt like this would be cheating her way out of that. Of course, she could always choose neither option, and simply try to get used to having three bodies for the time being, until she decided what she wanted to do about this.

"Gregor?" she asked, still not daring to open her eyes again. Three sets of ears hearing was already a bit much, all the murmuring around the dining hall being duplicated threefold, she wasn't ready for three sets of eyes seeing again.

Gregor seemed to already have an idea of what was on Cordelia's mind, and placed a reassuring hand on her original body's shoulder. "Do not have worries," he said, "Gregor is supporting you not matter what you choose."

A gentle smile came across all three of Cordelia's faces. "Thank you," she said, her bodies nodding. It was reassuring to have him in her corner as she tried to overcome this odd situation she'd put herself in. After much thought, doing her best to tune out everyone else's idle chatter, she finally came to a decision.

1113322222222111121111112222122111111221.content:
Robin closed her eyes, holding her hands to her face as the potion's magic made its effect on her. She had seen how Chrom reacted, but she still hadn't expected it to be this painful. Eventually the pain subsided, and Robin tried to open her eyes again, only to find she couldn't anymore. While some light had slipped through her eyelids before, she now stood in complete darkness, as if the sun had gone out. Her fingers felt the area her eyelids had previously been, only to find smooth skin in its place. She had lost her eyes.

Even though she could no longer see, Robin slowly lifted her head up and lowered her hands so the others in the room could see what had happened. All of a sudden, her ears were assaulted by a jumble of voices.

"Oh my..." "Uhhhh..." "WOAH!"

For some reason, the reactions seemed my louder than they'd been before. Robin covered her ears, unable to handle the jumbled loud noises reaching her. For a moment, it seemed like some blurry, monochrome images were starting to reach her vision, but they quickly faded away as the room began to quiet down. She heard some muffled footsteps, and then felt someone place a hand on her shoulder. Hesitantly, she lowered her hands.

"Are you okay, Robin?" she heard Chrom ask.

"I-I, I think so," Robin said, unsure. Even her own voice seemed louder now, and when she spoke, she could have sworn she could see Chrom's face, despite lacking eyes. "I, I just..."

Chrom pulled her into a hug, which Robin reciprocated. "It's alright."

"This is ridiculous," Robin heard a voice say that she assumed to be Maribelle. "How is this "seeing things differently"? Poor Robin can't see anything now."

"I suppose that is the trouble with trusting the vague descriptions Anna's supplier has given. They seem to be deliberately written in such a way as to give false expectations of their effect." The next voice seemed to be Miriel, and naturally, each sentence sounded like it come from a slightly different place.

"Well, I'll get the restore staff. I doubt she'll want to stay like this." Next was Anna's voice, although she was quieter than the rest. Robin was still able to clearly hear her, though. As the conversation was going on, however, Robin realised she was able to see the group standing just a little was away from her. Obviously she didn't have eyes to look at them with, but when they spoke, it was like a blurry images of the shapes that made up the surrounding area was forming an image in her minds eye, but only while they were speaking.

"Actually," Robin spoke up, still wrapped in Chrom's arms, "I think I can see... sort of. It's like I'm, seeing through sound, I guess."

"Seeing through sound?" "How does that work?" Lissa's voice piped up from two completely separate directions.

"I don't know, but when you were all talking, it was like I could make out an image of the area around us in my mind. Although it seems clearer when I'm talking myself." While the others in the room were talking, her mind's image seemed kind of blurry, but it was much sharper when she herself spoke. Still monochrome, and missing some detail, but still much clearer.

"Echolocation." That was Miriel's voice. "Some animals are able to locate objects around them by emitting a call and listening for the echo as the sound reverberates off of objects. That would also explain her earlier reaction, as she would likely need more sensitive hearing to accomplish such a feat."

"Well, I guess that's what it means by "seeing things differently"," Robin heard Anna say. "Anyway, I take it you want to be restored now?" Robin could hear footsteps, as the blurry shape of Anna approached.

“Come with me, okay?”

“Right,” said both of Anna’s bodies.

Anna’s new body started walking, and Anna’s humantaur body started to mimic the movements, but Lissa’s Sage body grabbed Anna’s humantaur body by the shoulder to keep her still. Lissa used her War Cleric body to guide Anna’s human body out of sight while she used her Sage body to hold Anna’s humantaur body still. Anna’s humantaur body continued trying to perform the same movements as her human body, which was now out of sight, but her arms and legs soon came to a stop.

“How are you feeling?” Lissa’s Sage body asked.

Anna’s humantaur body didn’t say anything, but after a few seconds, Lissa’s Sage body smiled.

“Hey, that’s great,” said Lissa. “You’ve mastered talking with only one body.”

“I assume her other body is speaking to you?” Miriel’s left head said.

“Yep,” said Lissa. “And I only spoke to her using this body, too.”

“I must say, it is strange, hearing only half of your conversation with Anna,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Yeah, it is kind of weird,” said Lissa. “I’m talking with the body I have here, but she’s talking with the body she has over there, but we can both have a full conversation.”

“I find the bond you have between your bodies to be fascinating,” said Miriel’s left head.

“It must be similar to the connection I have between by two heads, but on a much larger scale,” Miriel’s right head said.

“Can I take this blindfold off now?” Anna asked suddenly.

“Sure, if you think you can handle having two bodies now,” Lissa said.

“Yeah, I’ve got it,” said Anna as she reached up and pulled the blindfold off. “You were right about how easy it was to adapt, especially since my two bodies are so different.”

“I know, right?” said Lissa. “I can’t believe we’re having two different conversations right now.”

“What do you mean?” Miriel asked with her left head.

“Well, at the moment, I’m talking with Lissa about using a Second Seal with one of my bodies to further differentiate them,” said Anna.

“At the same time, we’re talking about how easy it is to adapt to having two bodies with you,” said Lissa, looking at Miriel. “We should be walking in now.”

As Lissa’s Sage body finished speaking, Lissa’s War Cleric body and Anna’s normal body came into view. Anna’s new body was dressed in the same red Trickster uniform Anna normally wore, identical to the clothes she had been wearing on her original body before she’d become a humantaur.

“When I work late, I stay here overnight,” Anna’s humantaur body said. “I’ve taken to leaving a spare set of clothes here.”

“I see,” said Miriel’s right head.

“Now that both your bodies are here, perhaps it is time we discuss what we do next,” said Miriel’s left head.

“Well, I’m going to head out and man the front desk,” said Anna’s new body. “Since this body is normal, I can take care of any business I might get while you’re testing the new potions and tomes.”

Once she finished speaking, Anna’s new body turned and walked out of the storeroom, leaving Anna’s humantaur body with Miriel and Lissa.

“You sure you’ll be alright?” Lissa’s War Cleric body asked. “You just got that body, after all.”

Anna’s humantaur body nodded. “I’ll be fine. I’ll just be standing and talking with my new body, anyway.”

“Very well, then,” said Miriel. “How do we wish to proceed?”

“Well, I could use another potion or tome on this body,” said Lissa’s War Cleric body.

“Or, I could go out and get another volunteer,” said Lissa’s Sage body. “With my War Cleric body, I mean. Obviously, I can’t go out like this.” Lissa’s Sage body gestured at her centre leg.

“Maybe you could use the duplication tome as well, Miriel,” said Anna’s humantaur body. “That way we’d have a fresh body to test a potion or a tome on.”

To the surprise of everyone in the room, the light faded to reveal that Lissa's new body was clothed in the exact same outfit as her original body, becoming a War Cleric rather than a Sage. "Hey, what gives?" Lissa's new body said.

"I was sure I was choosing Sage," her original body continued.

"So, they didn't promote at the same time, but they still both ended up promoting to the same thing?" Anna said as she scratched her head, thoroughly confused by what happened. She'd sold quite a few Master Seals in the past, and she'd never seen one give anyone the wrong class before.

"Hm. It would seem that despite your bodies not promoting simultaneously, they were both forced into the same class regardless," Miriel mused with her right head, before continuing with her left, and continuing to alternate thereafter. "Perhaps a change in one body sets up the potential for a change in the other, but it still requires the proper energy to set off the change. This could potentially create complications during testing."

"What do you mean?" Lissa's new body asked, as both her bodies turned to face Miriel.

"Well, for example, if we were to alter one of your bodies using one of the tomes, it could potentially set up the potential for the same alteration to occur in the other body, only requiring the introduction of magic to set it off. That could then interfere with the effects of a second tome, and falsely give the impression that both tomes performed the same alteration."

"What if we only alter one of my bodies, then?" Lissa's original body suggested.

"Or we could use a tome on one and a potion on the other," her new body said.

Before Miriel could reply, Anna interjected, having silently watched the exchange for the most part. "Are you sure you two are the same person?"

"Huh?" Lissa's new body asked, turning to face Anna with a look of confusion.

"Well, it's just, the way you suggested that almost made it sound like the second Lissa didn't want to get left out, and suggested something where you'd both be altered." Anna rocked back and forth on her heels, still finding the sensation of having four legs to be rather strange.

"Really?" Lissa's original body asked, looking at her new body, which had turned to face her.

"Yeah, I guess it did sorta sound like that," her new body continued.

"I do control both bodies though."

"We're not separate people."

Anna only found that exchange to be even stranger, as if Lissa was having a conversation with herself, when in reality, she was just alternating which body was saying which sentence as Miriel had been doing. Regardless, she kept her mouth shut this time.

"Anyway," Miriel interjected with her left head, trying to steer the conversation back on track, "I do believe it should be acceptable to try another tome or potion on at least one of your bodies. If nothing else, it should allow us to see how a transformation in one body affects the other."

Lissa didn't need any more approval than that, as both of her bodies headed over to the supplies, her old body looking through potions while her new body examined the tomes.

Lissa’s clone blinked a few times, then squeezed her eyes shut and shook her head.

“Whoa,” said Lissa’s clone. “I have the worst headache.” Lissa’s clone opened her eyes, then looked up at Lissa. “Wow! It worked! But, why am I naked?” Lissa’s clone asked, looking down at her naked body.

“That would be because you are the duplicate,” said Miriel’s left head.

“When I tested the head duplication potion, I discovered that clothes are not duplicated by the magic,” said Miriel’s right head.

“I’m the copy?” Lissa’s clone asked, frowning. “That can’t be right. I remember casting the spell and everything.”

“I was standing here the whole time,” said Lissa. “And you were standing really still for about a minute after I cast the spell. You’re the copy.”

“No,” said Lissa’s clone as tears began to well up in her eyes. “I can’t be the copy. I’m the real Lissa. I have to be!”

“Miriel and Lissa are right,” said Anna gently. “You were created by the tome only a few minutes ago.”

“No... I’m not a fake... I’m not...” Lissa’s clone choked out as tears rolled down her cheeks. “I’m Lissa... I’m real...”

Anna walked up to Lissa’s clone and gently hugged her as Lissa’s clone broke down into sobs.

“Hey, it’s okay,” said Anna soothingly. “We’ll sort this out. It’s going to be alright.”

“No, it’s not,” Lissa’s clone managed to say between sobs. “I’m not real. I’m just a fake.”

“No, don’t talk like that,” said Anna. “Just because you’re a duplicate, that doesn’t mean you’re not a real person. You’re just as real as everyone else, okay?”

“Okay,” Lissa’s clone said miserably as her sobbing began to ease.

“You feeling better now?” Anna asked as she let Lissa’s clone out of the hug and stepped back.

“Not really,” said Lissa’s clone. “I mean, I appreciate what you’re trying to do, but I’m still just a copy of the real Lissa.”

“No, you’re not,” said Lissa. “Sure, you may be a copy of me, but you’re still just as real as I am. You are your own person, even if you still have my memories and personality. Okay?”

Lissa’s clone took a few shaky breaths to calm herself, and nodded. “Okay. Thanks.”

Lissa smiled at her clone. “You’re welcome.”

“Perhaps it would be best if you came up with a new name for yourself,” said Miriel’s left head. “To help you distinguish yourself from Lissa.”

“Yeah, that’s probably a good idea,” said Lissa’s clone. “Um, how about Liz?”

“I think it’s a lovely name,” said Lissa with a smile. “Nice to meet you, Liz!”

“Of course you’d like it,” said the newly-christened Liz, rolling her eyes. “I’m you, remember?”

“No, you’re Liz,” said Lissa. “Just because we have the same memories doesn’t mean we’re the same person.”

“Yeah, I suppose you’re right,” said Liz. “It’s just going to take some getting used to, that’s all.”

“Well, I’m going to find you some clothes,” said Anna, walking off to a different part of the storeroom. “You can’t stay naked forever.”

Liz blushed, and tried to cover herself up with her hands.

“I have a question for you, Liz,” said Miriel’s right head.

The clone of Lissa, upon hearing the voice of the original Lissa, blinked a few times, then looked around the room in confusion.

“Where am I?” Lissa’s clone asked, sounding slightly panicked. “Who are you people? Why does that woman have two heads? And who am I?”

“Hey, hey, it’s okay, we’re not gonna hurt you,” said Lissa, holding her hands out placatingly. “What’s the last thing you remember?”

“I don’t remember anything,” said Lissa’s clone. “I don’t know who you are, or who I am, or anything.”

“I don’t? Why not?” asked Lissa’s clone.

“Well... because you didn’t exist until just now,” said Lissa.

Lissa’s clone cocked her head in confusion. “What do you mean?”

Lissa sighed. “Guess there’s no way to avoid this,” she said. Lissa picked up the tome she had dropped during her duplication and held it out to her clone. “You see this tome? I used it to cast a spell that would allow me to be in two places at once. That spell created you.”

“Well, that would explain why I don’t have any memories,” said Lissa’s clone. “And why I’m not wearing any clothes.”

“Well... yeah, but...”

“Am I acting like you? Talking like you?” Lissa’s clone asked, crossing her arms over her naked breasts.

“Well, no,” said Lissa. “Not really.”

“As for a name...” said Lissa thoughtfully. “How about Liz?”

Lissa’s clone shook her head. “Sounds too close to Lissa for my liking. I want something different.”

“Elizabeth?” asked Lissa.

Lissa’s clone was silent as she thought for a few seconds. “You know what? Sure, I’ll go with Elizabeth.”

Lissa giggled, and held out her hand. “Nice to meet you, Elizabeth. I’m Lissa.”

Elizabeth smiled, and shook Lissa’s hand. “It’s nice to meet you too, Lissa.”

“Thanks,” said Elizabeth, taking the clothes from Anna and quickly dressing herself. Once she was fully clothed, Elizabeth turned to face Miriel.

“So, I was created by magic,” said Elizabeth. “Is that how you got your second head?”

Miriel nodded her heads. “I drank a potion that caused me to grow a second head,” said Miriel’s left head.

“As mentioned earlier, Lissa used a tome to create you,” continued Miriel’s right head.

“Would you be interested in testing the potions and tomes with us?” Miriel’s left head asked.

Corrin was merely walking around the castle leisurely. Not too long ago, he was stuck in his own castle unable to leave or see the outside, so having another location wonder around was a breath of fresh air. Sure, the current situation with his two families was a little messy but it was nice to have a break from all the politics, violence and fighting that war involved. As he was walking he started to feel a little dizzy. His footsteps gradually becoming uneven he steadied himself against the wall as his vision started to blur and his head started to throb. Then suddenly, all his senses dropped out and he felt nothing.

He wasn't sure how much time past but suddenly he regained consciousness, finding himself kneeling on the floor. Blinking his eyes a few times to clear his vision he saw that he was still in the same hallway, however the sensations his body was sending him were telling him something was off. Turning his head to the side to look around he was caught off guard by the strange feeling of two weights hanging from his head. He quickly darted his hand up to his head and pulled forward two very long locks of blonde hair tied together on both sides by black hair ties. His investigation only brought attention to his hands which were not only covered in what appeared to be black gloves but were also rather small and dainty, the those of a young girl.

He quickly looked down at himself and noted what he was wearing, groaning internally. At his neck was a pink bow with an ornate silver rose at it's centre resting above what appeared to be a silver torso piece with black lining similar to the armour he usually wore, however with how tight fitting this was it was clear that he was no longer himself. From under the silver outer layer, his outfit billowed out into a knee length black dress with a pink lining decorating the hem of the skirt. "W-what..." he started to utter only to be caught off guard by the girly sound of his voice. While he had his hunches on what had happened to him he needed to confirm it.

With help from the wall to his side he slowly stood himself up, now becoming aware of the high-heeled boots that were around his feet. He took a few unsteady steps forward and made his way down the hallway. As he walked it became apparent that the changes he observed as he was on the ground earlier barely scratched the surface. After getting a rhythm of walking in these heels he found that the way his body moved as he took each step felt vastly different. The breeze against his bare legs was distracting as he had never worn a dress before and as he walked his now long locks of hair could be felt bobbing with his steps. As he past a couple maids along the way he noted how wear it was that while we usually looked down at them they now towered clearly above him. He tried to shake these thoughts from his mind as he stepped into his room.

Walking across the room he made his way to the full length mirror, his reason for coming here, and was confronted with what he feared. Looking at his reflection he saw a young girl, her hair in twintails held up by two black ribbons on each side framing the young juvenile face. She wore a black dress with puffy shoulders and black gloves, lined with pink at the hem and covered with an outer silver layer around her hips and chest, and her feet were clad in black high heeled boots which he could now see were now decorated with pink ribbons. Between the dress, the boots, the bow at her chest and the earrings he now wore, the amount of pink in the outfit he was wearing made the whole ordeal a lot more embarrassing. As he moved, the girl in the mirror moved, and it was hard to deny that he had suddenly become his little sister Elise, the young budding princess of the Kingdom of Nohr.

"Ummm, hello?" Corrin was suddenly snapped out of thoughts by a voice. Turning around he found himself face to face with his own body, or at least the one he was suppose to have. "Is that you big brother?" Corrin's body said to him. It didn't take a lot of detective work to figure out who it was inhabiting his body right now.

"Elise?" he responded, the squeaky voice escaping his mouth still a little jarring to hear. His body simply nodded in response. He took a couple steps closer to 'himself' taken aback by how much taller his body was than him at this moment, "So... any idea how this happened?"

"Well..." Elise said from his body, "I wanted to help you out so I decided to try a spell from this book I found but, something went wrong..." she explained, fidgeting uncomfortably, it was a little weird seeing his body act this way. "But, I think I can fix it!" she continued, pulling out the book in question.

Corrin honestly wanted to trust in his sister but after the way things turned out already, it was clear that maybe letting her cast spells from the book willy-nilly wasn't a great idea. It would probably be a better idea to find someone more experienced to help them out of this situation. On the other hand, if it's simply reversing what happened, maybe it would be simple enough for Elise to do without any worry.
