Corrin decided to give his support to Elise. He did find the experience being her for a bit fascinating, however he didn't exactly like the idea of staying this way for much longer. Any option that got him back to normal quicker is definitely preferred, and it was just a simple reversal of the spell after all. "Okay, lets get this over with!" Corrin said eagerly, the enthusiasm in his voice scarily sounding exactly like the usual Elise.

Rubbing his eyes he looked up and saw his original body still standing there.

"Okay... I don't think that worked..." the boy in front of him muttered.

Corrin looked down at herself and sure enough was greeting with the body of a young girl once again. A little bit of worry started to set in looking up at the boy in front of her "So... what do we do now Big Brother" she said, her voice marked with concern.

"I'm not sure..." Elise mumbled in response, "Wait, what did you call me?"

Corrin's eyes went wide in shock, she had just called Elise in her body 'big brother', and what's more she didn't even think anything of it until it was pointed out, "Oh no, I think the spell messed with our heads!" she said in panic. The more she thought about it, it was true. She was no longer bothered by what she was wearing, in fact she thought the outfit looked rather cute. All the knowledge of swordplay and milltary tactics were gone, now replaced with knowledge of etiquette and spellcraft, and the way her mind formed thoughts was very different to how it had been a few moments ago. She couldn't even remember how long 'she' had been referring to herself as a female.

121112121221.content:
As Elise cast the spell, she continued to watch Corrin, waiting for it to take effect. She wasn't sure exactly what it would do, but just in case it wasn't something he liked, she did her best to hide from view so he wouldn't know it was her who did it. However, she eventually started to grow impatient as nothing seemed to be happened.

She gave a disappointed sigh. Either she'd done something wrong, or the spell had just been a dud. Or at least, that's what she thought. As she turned away, she missed seeing that Corrin had begun to stumble, suddenly feeling incredibly drowsy. Of course, that didn't really matter, as Elise soon because to feel the exact same way. She was a bit startled, as while she assumed this might have had something to do with the spell, she was pretty sure it wasn't supposed to effect her. She didn't have much time to think about that, however, as she, alongside Corrin, soon passed out, all of her senses fading to black.

~~~

Corrin groggily opened his eyes, groaning a little at how uncomfortable the floor seemed to be. Though his mind was still a little foggy after waking up, he seemed to recall that he was walking down the hallway of the castle when a sudden wave of drowsiness came over him, eventually causing him to pass out. He had no idea what had caused it, but he hoped it wasn't anything serious, like an enemy spellcaster or something.

As he slowly sat up, he couldn't help but feel like something was wrong. His armour felt so much lighter and softer than it had before, and it felt like there was something hanging from either side of his head. Rubbing his eyes a little, he looked down at himself to see what was going on. In an instant, he was wide awake.

Gone was his black and white armour. Instead, a somewhat cute black and white dress with pink trimming covered his body. The sleeves poofed out and tucked into a pair of tight black gloves. His feet were no longer bare, now encased within a pair of black, high heeled boots wrapped in pink ribbons. Though he couldn't see beneath the dress, he could tell from the way his bare and strangely smooth thighs rubbed together that he was no longer wearing any pants. His underwear seemed oddly soft, and he could feel something similar tightly wrapped around his flat chest. As he frantically took stock of his body, he caught sight of a pair of large, curled pigtails, reaching all the way down to his hips, clearly being the thing he could feel earlier.

Naturally, Corrin recognised the outfit he was wearing, and the hairstyle he'd been given; it belonged to his younger sister, Elise. But why was he suddenly wearing Elise's clothes? At first he thought this might be some sort of prank, and someone had put him to sleep and and dressed him up like this, but that didn't really make sense. If these were really Elise's clothes, they should be too small for him, but nothing felt too tight, as if it were perfectly tailored for him, and it didn't explain how his hair had become long enough for Elise's hairstyle. Something strange was going on, and he needed to get to the bottom of it, preferably before anyone saw him dressed as his little sister.

"Huh? What's going on?" Corrin heard a voice say from around the corner. Naturally, he recognised the voice, as it belonged to the very person whose clothes he was wearing; his younger sister, Elise. Quickly getting up to his feet, Corrin headed around the corner, somehow managing to not stumble in Elise's heels. There, he found Elise sitting around where he'd been when he passed out, although much like him, she wasn't dressed in her usual attire. Instead, she wore the very same black and white armour he'd previously been wearing, and her hair seemed to have shortened itself into his usual style, although she had kept her own hair colour.

"Big brother?" Corrin called out, only to immediately cover his mouth once he realised what he'd said. That wasn't what he'd been trying to say at all. It sounded more like what Elise would normally say to him.

"Elise, I- Ah!" Elise responded, reacting in a similar way once she realised what she'd called Corrin. "That, that wasn't what I meant to say."

"Do you have any idea what's going on?" Corrin asked. He doubted she knew any more than he did, but considering they were in the same predicament, it seemed worth a shot.

Elise looked around nervously, trying to see if there was anyone else in the hallway. "I, um... Come with me!" Elise quickly got up and took Corrin by the hand, practically dragging him back to her room. Presumably she wanted to make sure no one saw them like this while they discussed what was going on.

As they ran, Corrin couldn't help but ponder about ahow natural Elise's clothes felt. They were incredibly different to his old clothes, but he almost felt like he'd been wearing this sort of thing for years. He had no trouble navigating the halls wearing Elise's heels, he knew how to move in a skirt so as not to expose anything, even his incredibly long hair wasn't proving cumbersome for him. Overall, though different, everything felt as comfortable as his own clothes would have been, and he didn't really understand why. Something had clearly changed beyond their clothes.

Once they reached Elise's room, Elise lead Corrin inside of shut the door behind them, giving them ample privacy to talk. "So, what's going on?" Corrin asked. If Elise was acting that frantically, she must have known something.

"Well, I, uh, I may have cast a spell on you without asking. I'm sorry," Elise replied, guiltily looking down at her now bare feet.

"I-It's alright. I'm not mad. But, why did you cast a spell that'd swap our clothes?" While the ordeal had confused Corrin quite a bit, he was thankful that Elise's spell seemingly hadn't done anything worse.

"Well, that's not what it was supposed to do... At least, I don't think it was. I can't really remember now, for some reason."

Without even thinking, Corrin said, "it was supposed to make you into a better version of yourself."

Elise seemed a little startled by Corrin's sudden answer. "Uh, yeah, that's it. How did you know?"

Corrin was equally startled, considering he was pretty sure there was no way he should have known what kind of spell Elise was performing. "I don't know. It just sort of... came to me, I guess. Anyway, could you reverse the spell now? Your clothes are pretty comfortable, but I don't really want to be seen wearing them."

Despite Corrin's request, Elise seemed to be focused on other things, and was staring intently at something. "Uh, Elise?" she said, once again using the wrong name.

Despite what she'd said, Corrin was more concerned about what she was looking at, and turned his head in the same direction, only to let out a small gasp. "What the...?"

The pair was looking at the full length mirror that hung from the wall of Elise's room. Corrin expected to see himself reflect wearing Elise's clothes, but what he was saw something entirely different. Reflected on the mirror's surface was the same old Corrin and Elise that they'd always been, only their positions were reversed. Where Corrin stood in Elise's clothes, Elise stood in the mirror, wearing her usual outfit, and likewise for Elise and the Corrin in the reflection. Corrin slowly raised his hand to confirm what he was seeing, and the reflected Elise copied his actions.

"What on earth is going on?" Corrin asked aloud, watching as Elise's reflection mimicked his mouth movements.

"Maybe... Maybe the spell made it so that everyone thinks we're each other, but we still see ourselves as normal?" Elise suggested, trying to rationalise the bizarre situation they'd been put into.

"I guess. If I'm you now, then that'd explain why I know something only you would know, and why we keep messing up each other's names."

"Right." Turning away from the mirror, Elise looked over at her desk, which held the spellbook that had caused all of this in the first place. "We should probably try to fix this. I don't really want to be you for the rest of my life."

"Yeah, me neither." Corrin approached the book, reading what was written on the open page, although it all seemed very familiar to him now. A small frown appeared on his face. "Um, I know this is the spell that swapped us, but that's not what it was supposed to do, right? How do we know it'll actually do that if we cast it again?"

"I... I guess we don't know that," Elise replied, suddenly realising that swapping back might not be as easy as she hoped. "Well, there's still a chance it'll do the right thing. Or, maybe we can find a spell that's supposed to do what this one did?"

Corrin shook his head. "I've never seen a spell like that before," he said, even though it was Elise's knowledge of spells he was tapping into and not his own. "Although there could be something on this sort of thing in the library."

1211121212213.content:
But before the pair could even think about casting another spell, there was a knock at the door. Corrin and Elise instantly froze in place, unsure of what would happen were anyone else to see them this way. Until the door opened and in walked Kaze, the green haired Hoshidan ninja, and more importantly Elise’s husband. He looked around the room with his usual stern expression, though once he spotted Corrin and Elise, his face formed into a smile.
“Ah! Here you are Elise!” He said with a voice of relief.

Quickly making his way towards the pair, Kaze opened his arms wide in order to lovingly embrace his beautiful wife. However, instead of sharing his affection with the small Elise, he planted a deep affectionate kiss on Corrin’s lips. Corrin jumped back in surprise, startled at Kaze’s advances. At first, he tried to push Kaze away and break the kiss. But as their lips continued meshing, tongues colliding in an exchange of saliva, Corrin found it harder and harder to escape. His face became red and flushed, heart beating faster and faster. His tongue eagerly played along with Kaze’s, as his loins began to stir up in a heat. Was he… Was he enjoying this?
“Kaze!” Elise yelled in distress. “What are you doing?!”

On the other hand, anyone here was not enjoying the moment it was definitely Elise. She couldn’t believe Kaze was making out with Corrin! However, rather than being jealous she wasn’t the one kissing Kaze, she was more upset at the fact that Kaze and Corrin were displaying their show of affection in front of her. In fact, the thought of kissing Kaze herself kind of grossed her out. Why would she kiss some ugly guy when she could kiss beautiful girls? Elise gulped. This spell was more powerful than she thought! It was already altering her mind heavily, she needed to turn back as soon as she could!

Noticing Elise’s discomfort, Kaze finally broke the kiss with Corrin. “Ahh! Sorry about that Lord Corrin.” Kaze said, catching his breath. “Force of habit.”
Elise forced an anxious smile. “I-I-i’s fine.” She sighed. “What brings you here anyways, Kaze?”

“Oh! Right.” Kaze piped up. He turned towards Corrin, who was still hazy from the kiss. “Darling, little Midori has been acting up for a while and I can’t get her to calm down. I think she needs her mommy.”

Kaze’s words bounced around Corrin’s dazed head. Midori wanted him? He was a… “Mother?” He unintentionally uttered aloud.

“Yes.” Kaze dutifully replied. “I think she might be hungry. Unfortunately, she hasn’t quite gotten used to the bottle, so I figured if you weren’t busy you could maybe come and…”

“Breastfeed?!” The words burst out of Corrin’s mouth. With his mind still in the clouds, Corrin could barely process what was happening. Kaze wanted HIM, to breastfeed his daughter? But Corrin was a boy! Could he even do that? Yet, at the same time, Midori was his daughter. What kind of mother would he be if he couldn’t at least do that for her?

“Absolutely not!” Elise interjected, before Corrin could give an answer. “’Elise’ here is very busy right now, so she can’t help you.”

“B-but big brother!” Corrin cried out. “Little Midori isn’t even a year old. As her mother, I can’t leave her in distress like this!”

At that moment, Elise really wanted to yell at Corrin that he wasn’t Midori’s actual mother, but given that Kaze was here, she decided to stay calm. That kiss really must have done a number on Corrin. He was still blushing and sweating, with confusion painted all over his face. Her memories must have started to mix with his, so she couldn’t let him leave. She had to find a way to change them back before it was too late!

“NO!!” Corrin yelled out, his heart beating quickly, his emotions running wild. “My little daughter needs her mother right now! I need to go to her!”

With tear drops forming in his eyes, Corrin dashed out of the room at full speed.

“Elise, no!” Elise yelled in distress as Corrin darted through the door and into the hallway.

Without hesitation, she began to chase after him, feeling a new-found surge of speed and power she’d never felt with her tiny body before. However, just as she reached the door, it suddenly shut close right in front of her. A look of bewilderment appeared on her face. Frantically, Elise tried to turn the doorknob, only to find that the door was locked.

“What the-?” She whispered.

“I’m sorry Lord Corrin.” Suddenly Kaze’s voice came from the other side of the door.

“Kaze?!” Elise asked angrily. “Did you do this? Open this door right now!”

“I’m afraid I can’t do that Lord Corrin.” Kaze responded calmly. “While you might be the leader and commander of this army, I’m sorry to say that the wishes of my wife and child supersede those of my master.”

Elise could feel her teeth grinding. “But don’t worry!” Kaze continued. “It won’t take long! Once Elise is done, I’ll send her right over to you, alright?”

With that, Kaze disappeared as fast as he’d appeared. “KAZEEEE!!!” Elise yelled out furiously, as she smacked the door with her fist.

~~~~

“Haa… Haa… Haaa…” Corrin huffed tiredly, exhausted from all the running he did.

He stopped in the middle of the hallway, placing his right hand on the wall to support himself. Gosh he was so out of shape. This was all because he always let his horse carry him all over the battlefield, instead of walking through it for himself. Maybe he should take up Camilla’s offer for some sister-on-sister exercise…

Corrin shook his head madly. He didn’t use a horse to travel the battlefield! Gah! Having Elise’s life was causing her memories to jumble up his mind. And apparently they were also making his body weaker. Corrin sighed. Thanks to his new girly emotions, he’d unintentionally run away from Elise and gotten himself in an even bigger mess than before. He should probably head back to his room and try to find a way to fix this before things really got out of ha-

“Lady Elise?” Out of nowhere, Kaze suddenly appeared behind Corrin.

“Ka- Kaze!” Corrin yelled in surprise, his cheeks becoming red as he stared into the ninja’s face.

“I’m very sorry to have caused you and your brother to fight, but I really needed your help.” Kaze said calmly. “Although I will say, I’m very happy you chose to help Midori and I over him.”

“O-of course Kaze!” Corrin spoke confidently, grasping Kaze’s shoulders and staring into his eyes. “I love you and Midori more than anything in the world. I wouldn’t give either of you up, even for my brothers or sister.” The words had all come out of Corrin’s mouth instinctively. Corrin blushed even harder as he realized what he said, averting his gaze from Kaze’s.

“Thank you, Elise.” Kaze said with a smile. “I also love you and Midori more than anything in the world.”

Kaze’s sweet voice made Corrin’s heart flutter in joy. He couldn’t understand how happy they made him. If Corrin didn’t know better, he’d actually believe he was the one who’d fallen in love with Kaze, and not that these were Elise’s feelings transferred into him thanks to the swap. Yet, at the same time, the sensations of affection felt so real to Corrin. Almost as if it wasn’t possible for them to be directed at anyone but him.

“Hmm… You look tired.” Kaze told him. In an instant, Corrin found himself in the arms of Kaze, being carried by the ninja as if it was no problem. “Shall I take you to my room then?”

Hearts formed in Corrin’s eyes, joy bursting in droves into his mind. “Y-Yes please!” He said dreamily.

And without wasting a single moment, the two were off.


Once Corrin drew near to Kaze’s room, he began to see what to see what the problem was. Far outside of the room, he could hear Midori’s loud cries and wails. It was actually quite impressive that such a small child could make such a large amount of noise. Stopping before the door to his room, Kaze let Corrin down.

“Here we are.” He said with a sigh, opening up the door for Corrin. “Please come in.”

Corrin complied without second thought. Stepping into the Hoshidan’s room, it was quite noticeably different from his. The furniture was much more simplistic and less ornate, with everything dyed to Kaze’s signature green color instead of Corrin’s favorite pink. But the part that really mattered was in the corner, a large wooden crib where the loud cries were coming from.

Wanting to waste no time, Corrin quickly made his way to the corner of the room, with Kaze dutifully following behind him. A little bit of Corrin was scared that he wouldn’t be of any help. He had no experience with children after all, and most importantly he was a boy. But another part of him was determined. This was his- err- Elise’s daughter in pain, and he was the only one who could do anything to help her. What kind of person would he be if he didn’t help?

Then, as Corrin stepped before the crib and took a look at the wailing baby, a loud gasp left his mouth. He ducked inside of the crib and placed the young child within his arms, carrying her with the utmost of care. As he brought her up close to him, he could clearly see her face to face. It was the young baby Midori, with hair that was as white as the snow in the Hoshidan mountaintops. Hair that was as white as… his own.

This was all the proof Corrin needed. This was his daughter, beyond the shadow of a doubt. He was her mother. Anything that said otherwise was fathomably untrue. The feeling of joy that swelled his heart as he watched over her were undeniable. This young crying creature he held in his arms, he loved it more than he’d loved anything else in his life.

Filled with newfound determination, Corrin quickly undid the top part of his elaborate dress. He slid the left strap of his bra off his left arm, letting the padding fall to reveal his exposed nipple to the cold air of the room. Then, with motherly care, he gently lifted Midori’s mouth up to it, allowing the baby suckle away at her mother’s tender nip.

For a moment, doubt and anxiety filled Corrin’s mind. Yes, he was Midori’s mother, but was also still a boy. The spell had only swapped his and Elise’s life. Would he be able to produce milk for his hungering daughter? But as soon as Corrin felt his nipple tingle, all his worries washed away. Almost as if by magic, milk began to pour from Corrin’s nipple and into Midori’s young mouth. Corrin didn’t know how to explain it, but he didn’t care. His daughter was drinking his milk happily, so he was happy.

Corrin began to rock his arms side to side lightly as Midori eagerly sucked his nipple. She was so beautiful, the way she hungrily suckled at her mother’s teat, how plump and cute her cheeks were, and how soft and pretty her white hair was. Corrin just couldn’t help but stare down lovingly at the beautiful creature.

Happy to see the scene that was unfolding before him, Kaze stepped forward and placed his arms on Corrin’s shoulders. “Beautiful, isn’t she?” Kaze asked Corrin, looking down onto Midori with a smile.

“The most beautiful thing in the world.” Corrin responded confidently, not wanting to turn away from the baby. Though this time, the words that came from his mouth were completely intentional.

“I don’t know about that.” Kaze laughed jovially. “Maybe the second most beautiful thing in the world…”

A giggle escaped Corrin’s mouth. “Oh yeah? And what’s the most beautiful thing then?” He asked, turning towards Kaze with a smile.

“You.” Without any warning, Kaze leaned down and planted a kiss on Corrin’s unsuspecting lips.

This time though, Corrin didn’t fight it. On the contrary, he entirely embraced it, meshing his lips and moving his tongue with all the joy in the world. All this love Kaze was giving him, Corrin didn’t want to reject it. It made his heart beat faster, his blush grow redder and his penis grow… harder. At this point, he couldn’t deny it any longer. Corrin was in love with Kaze. He was in love with Midori. He was in love with being a mother, with being a wife, with having a… family. This moment, Corrin wouldn’t exchange it for anything.

Finally, as their lips departed, Kaze and Corrin stared lovingly into each other’s eyes. Kaze smiled.

“Oh my… What a naughty mother.” He said, placing his hand over Corrin’s hardened bulge. “Getting aroused while breastfeeding?”

“Kyaaa! Kaze!” Corrin yelped, trying to move away from his hand. “Not in front of Midori.”

Kaze wasn’t about to let up though. He put his body closer to Corrin’s, rubbing his hand gently over his wife’s erect penis. “Oh, come on darling. I’m sure little Midori wouldn’t mind sharing her mother for a minute.” He said, planting little kisses in the base of Corrin’s neck.

But his attempts proved unsuccessful “No!” Corrin yelled with feign anger, slapping his hand away from Corrin’s crotch. He stomped away from Kaze, his face forming into Elise’s signature pout. “I’m going to feed Midori and then I’m put her to sleep. And until she’s sleeping cozily in her crib, we are NOT doing any playing around. Understood?”

“Yes ma’am.” Kaze responded with a smile.

121112121221313.content:
Elise sighed, her hands pressed against the door. How could things go so wrong? All she'd wanted was to help Corrin, but now she was stuck in Corrin's life, locked in her old room, and Corrin had run off with her husband. To make matters worse, though, she could feel her own memories starting to blend with Corrin's. Corrin had clearly already fallen to the same fate, Kaze's kiss muddling his mind so much he could no longer distinguish his own thoughts from those her life had forced upon him. She was doing the best she could to fight it off and retain some sense of self, but the longer she stayed like this, the harder it became to keep Corrin's thoughts separate.

She'd had a look over the book that contained the spell that had done this to them, but she wasn't able to make heads or tails of it. Despite still remembering that she was the one that cast the spell in the first place, it seemed all of her knowledge of magic was stuck inside Corrin's head, leaving her with his swordplay skills. She might still be able to cast it, but she was worried about screwing things up even more. It wasn't as if she had much to lose at this point, but for all she knew, she could accidentally end up switching their bodies to match their lives, or making them forget about who they really were. No, this would have to wait. At the very least, she'd need Corrin to come back and work the same magic she'd done, and at most, she'd need to find someone more experienced with magic to try and figure out what she did wrong, and how to fix it.

None of that mattered if she couldn't get out of this room, though. Kaze's insistence on having "Elise" come with him had left the real Elise trapped, stuck with Corrin's mind trying to eclipse her own. No matter how much she rattled the doorknob, it refused to open, having been blocked from the other side. Corrin slowly walked the halls of the castle, having no real destination in mind. He was simply happy to be out of the old fortress he had been confined to for most of his life, and back in the main castle with the rest of his family. Returning to these old halls was like a breath of fresh air to him, and despite the less than favourable circumstances between his two families, he couldn't help but feel at peace for just this brief moment.

Unbeknownst to Corrin, however, this momentary peace was about to be interrupted in an unbelievable way. It was imperceptible, save for a slight waver in the air, but a rush of magical energy was flowing through the castle, searching for something. Corrin didn't get a chance to see this energy, but he certainly felt it as it rushed right into him, disappearing within his body as it pushed him back a little, winding him.

"W-What was that?" Corrin stuttered as he steadied himself, trying to get his breath back. He didn't see anything, but it felt like something had rammed into his stomach. Unless his enemies were capable of making invisible weapons, he could only assume that his assailant had used magic, an assumption that only proved to be more likely once he noticed how his body felt... strange. That was the only word he could think of to describe it. It was as if his body, his flesh and body, and strangely even his clothing, was becoming soft and malleable, and a pulsing energy source from within his gut was sending ripples through him. The pulses grew in frequency and intensity, forcing himself to brace himself against the wall, or else he'd have collapsed to the floor. It felt as if he would explode if the pulses grew any stronger, and in a sense, that was exactly what happened, though not in a way Corrin could ever had imagined, even in his wildest dreams.

By now the pulses were so quick Corrin could scarcely tell one from the next, and it felt as if it were vibrating his entire being. It was at this point that the pulses began to reshape his body, so quickly that he had no time to process what was actually happening. One pulse rushed through his body, stretching it out to make him a little taller, and forcing his limbs into the right proportions. Another pushed flesh away from his torso, particularly his waist. His skin was made soft and delicate, as if he had put much time into taking care of it. His hand and feet were reshaped to become more dainty and feminine. The muscles in his arms and legs grew stronger, and yet less pronounced. Atop his muscles, a soft layer of feminine fat was placed, particularly on his thighs. His hips were forced outwards as his rear grew to match, and a certain something on the other side vanished within him. His chest exploded outwards, two large sphere hanging from his body. His hair rocketed outwards, trailing down to his rear as it covered one of his eyes. His face was restructured, taking on a decidedly feminine appearance, and looking almost sultry and seductive despite his situation.

Though his body was already nigh unrecognisable, the pulses continued, this time reshaping his clothing. It sunk in at his waist, accentuating his curves, and opened to reveal his new breasts. His cape shortened up to his mid-back, and stronger plates appeared at his elbows. Large metal tridents hung from his hips, as material pulled away from his crotch to create some sheer drapings. His normally bare feet were encased withing armoured high heeled boots. Atop his head, a tiara came into existence, horns jutting from either side of his head.

Just as quickly as it had started, the pulses began to slow back down, Corrin's body feeling like it was solidifying once more, though whether he could even call it his body anymore was debatable. He could do nothing but stare in shocked silence as he looked at the shapely female form he now possessed. He could barely even more without accentuating some difference within his body, from the swaying of his breasts to the void between his legs. Though despite the shock, there was something at the back of his mind, thinking there was something familiar about all this.

"What happened to me?" Corrin said exasperatedly, before raising his hands to is mouth with a gasp. He recognised that voice. He sounded just like his big sister, Camilla. In fact, with that in his mind, he realised his body was now an exact replica of her's. Well, "exact" wasn't entirely correct. Strangely, though he certainly possessed her form, the colour scheme of his clothes had remained the same, his white, black, and blue taking the place of Camilla's black, gold, and purple, and his hair was still the same pale silver. Regardless of the difference in colours, he was still shaped exactly like his big sister, right down to the core.

"This is impossible," he mumbled. Corrin had very little experience with magic, so in his world, what he had just experienced was completely unbelievable, and yet, the evidence sat right in front of his eyes. He couldn't be seen like this, he would be mortified beyond all belief. He needed to find a way to turn back to normal, and possible capture whatever villain decided to play such a cruel trick on him. But right now, he wasn't in the right state of mind to go looking for a solution; he wasn't experienced enough with magic to reverse it himself, and he was pretty sure he'd die from embarrassment if anyone saw him in Camilla's shapely form right now. Corrin slowly awoke after a somewhat restless night. He could vaguely remember having an incredibly strange dream. He could remember some sort of spirit, and it pulled his soul of his body, and flung it away. He didn't remember where his soul landed in the dream, though.

Considering his retainers hadn't come to wake up up yet, he could only assume it was still fairly early, but he felt well rested regardless, so he decided to get up. As he opened his eyes, though, he found himself in an unfamiliar room. He quickly sat up, a little panicked about where he was. This certainly didn't resemble his room, nor any he'd seen in Castle Krackenburg. In fact, from the items strewn around the room and the general architecture, the entire place looked for more Hoshidan than it did Nohrian. Having sided with Nohr, and been branded a traitor by his Hoshidan family, that worried him more than anything.

As he looked around, taking in the entire room, something odd caught his attention. However, this time, it was not something about the room, but rather something that darted in and out of his vision every time he turned his head, as if it were hanging on the sides of his head. He reached up and pulled it around to where he could see it. It was hair, long brown hair. It looked nothing like Corrin's own hair, but from the tugging sensation on his scalp, it seemed like it was indeed attached to him. That oddity then drew his attention to the hand holding the hair. While it still showed signs of labor, it was much smaller, and more feminine looking. Fear furthered its grip on him, as his eyes followed down the slim, but strong, arm attached to the hand, all the way down to a young, female body, clothed in some sort of nightgown. ...HIS young, female body, clothed in some sort of nightgown, he realised. Considering her perspective, he could think of no other explanation. Not to mention, the lacking feeling in his crotch made it obvious he lacked an important part that designated him as male.

"What? What happened to me?" Corrin wondered aloud, hearing a feminine voice escape his lips. He quickly got up off the bed, finding himself to be a lot shorter than he used to be, and searched for a mirror. The only one he could find was a small one sitting atop a nearby dresser, but it sufficed for what he needed it for. In the mirror, he saw the face of a young girl, one he'd never met before. "That's... me?" The girl in the mirror matched his mouth movements. Somehow, he had become this girl.

All of a sudden, he heard a knock at the door. "Hana, are you in there?" he heard a voice on the other side say. He recognised the voice, having just heard it some days prior; it belonged to his Hoshidan younger sister, Sakura. Judging by what she'd said, Corrin could only assume that the girl whose body he currently possessed was named Hana.

"Um, yes, Lady Sakura," Corrin replied, not even realising he'd referred to Sakura as "Lady Sakura" on pure instinct.

The door of the door opened slightly, and he saw Sakura's face peering through the crack. "Are you okay? Normally you'd already be awake and training by now."

"Oh, um, I guess I overslept. Sorry." Corrin did his best to sound convincing, but having never met this Hana girl before, it was rather difficult for him to imitate her.

"Well, okay. Just remember, we're heading out to Fort Jinya today, so you'd better get ready." With that, Sakura closed the door, and Corrin heard her footsteps walking away.

Corrin let out a breath he hadn't even realised he'd been holding. It was bad enough that he'd woken up as a girl, one he'd never met, but to also be back in Hoshido, where he'd been branded a traitor? Now he was even more on edge. If anyone realised who he was, he'd be thrown into the dungeon, or worse. He supposed all he could do until he figured out what had happened was pretend to be this Hana girl. From the way Sakura had spoken to him, and the multitude of katanas lying around the room, he guessed Hana was probably one of Sakura's retainers, or at the very least, one of Sakura's friends who was part of the Hoshidan army.

But how could he even find out how this had happened? He had no idea where to start. He didn't even know if the culprit was Nohrian or Hoshidan. If only he had some help, but who could he turn to? If he revealed his identity, he'd either be laughed at for spouting nonsense, or he'd be locked up for being a traitor. Corrin let out a sigh. The situation seemed hopeless. For now, he supposed he should carry on with Hana's life, and get ready for the day.

As he finished the final stroke of the name, the Talisman appeared to glow warming before a gust of wind began to swirl around it. As the vortex of wind began to grow he began to lose all sense of weight, before he suddenly felt a rush like he was being ripped away before his mind went blank. Then that lack of feeling dissipated, and he began to feel as if he was shrinking and being cramped into a small space, as if something was constraining him, trapping him within and solidifying around him. And then he slowly regained the sensation of his limbs, easing into the feeling of a normal bodily experience... except everything felt strangely out of place. He opened his eyes to find that somehow he had been transported outside in a courtyard of the castle grounds. The bright sun flared down, only obstructed by the shade of a nearby cherry blossom tree. As he walked towards his destination he couldn't help but find how different the body he was in. To begin with, Sakura's body felt a lot lighter than his own body and was rather small, and the way the air freely swirled around his upper thighs was incredibly distracting for him. Though, he'd be lying if he didn't enjoy this just a little but, after all in the hot summer weather, the stuffy armour he wore into battle wasn't exactly comfortable so he enjoyed the freedom of movement a little bit. Though thinking on movement, the act of walking in this form was also a rather odd experience. His wider hips gave him a more effeminate gait. His hip would jut out to the side first, the legs only following on after that. Sure, it probably felt natural for girls to walk this way, but he couldn't quite get use to it. 12112212111.content:
Corrin decided it would be best to check on his own body first, before going to see Orochi. Knowing how timid she usually was, she was probably panicking, having suddenly found herself in her older brother's body. He still didn't feel quite comfortable walking around in Sakura's body, and not going to see Orochi yet would mean he'd be in Sakura's body for longer, but he was willing to endure to make sure his sister was okay.

He eventually reached his own room without incident, and opened up the door without bothering to knock. Inside he was he own body standing at his desking, turning the talisman over in its hands worriedly. "Sakura?" Corrin asked, still a bit put off by the fact that he was speaking with Sakura's voice instead of his own.

In shock at someone walking in, Corrin's body flinched a bit as it turned towards him, dropping the talisman on the desk in the process, before it properly processed what Corrin had actually said. "B-Big brother?" he body asked in a nervous tone, confirming that the swap was indeed mutual, and Sakura was now in Corrin's body.

Corrin breathed a small sigh of relief now that both he and Sakura were accounted for, and nodded in response to Sakura's question. "Are you alright?" he asked. It seemed like a silly thing to ask, considering neither of them could really be considered "alright" at the moment, but he struggled to think of what else he could really say to comfort her in this situation.

"I-I... um, h-how did this h-happen? W-Why am I you?" Sakura asked, clearly distressed by the situation.

Corrin gestured towards the talisman on the table. "Orochi gave me a talisman that she said would "help me understand someone better" if I wrote their name on it. I had no idea this is what she meant. I'm sorry. If I'd known, I would have never written your name down." He placed a hand on her shoulder, trying to be as comforting as he could, although it just served to remind him of how much smaller he was now, only just reaching his former body's shoulders.

"I-It's okay. It's not y-your fault." Sakura seemed to be gathering what little courage she could muster, although her stutter was still clearly coming through, even in Corrin's body. "So, w-what now? How do we s-switch back?"

Corrin let out a sigh. "I'm not sure. Orochi obviously didn't explain to me how the talisman works. I don't suppose you know anything about this sort of thing?"

Sakura shook her head. "I m-mostly work with healing magic."

"Well, in that case, our best option is probably to go see Orochi. I'm sure she'll be able to change us back, or at least explain how the talisman works so we can do it herself."

"O-Okay..." Sakura didn't seem entirely too sure about Orochi willingly cooperating, but she agreed it was probably their best option. Corrin still founding it odd to see his body acting so timidly, let alone seeing his body from this perspective at all, but he supposed he'd just have to bare it until they could get Orochi to swap them back. Hopefully they wouldn't encounter anyone else and have to try and mimic each other, as Corrin had a feeling Sakura wouldn't be up to the task.

"I don't know exactly how to say this... but I'm not 'Lady Sakura'..." he said, his more uncomfortable tone in this case actually sounding rather close to the real Sakura. Corrin could only sit there, confused at the reaction of the woman in front of him.

Orochi slowly started to compose herself, "Ah... of course I know who you are! Who do you think gave you that Talisman!" she said, wiping a tear from the corner of her eye, "Of course, I was surprised that you chose Sakura for this charm. I was expecting you to choose Ryouma or Hinoka actually but look at you, ever the caring older brother... or I suppose little sister now?" the mocking tone of her voice was starting to irritate Corrin but he kept his composure.

"How did you know I chose Sakura... I only just got here..." he said.

Orochi smiled, "Well, I visited her a moment ago. I knew you'd use the charm eventually so I checked on you from time to time throughout the day." she explained, "Oh, but don't worry your pretty little head about her she's doing fine now." As she finished speaking she pulled out a similar looking Talisman and started writing on it.

Even if she is in my body she doesn't know the first thing about swordsmanship, and I could barely push open your door let alone wield a sword as I am now!"

Orochi merely sighed and took a break from writing to look up at him, staring him straight in the face, "Need I remind you, you're the one that asked for this. On top of that while you may be unhappy with this, I'm not reversing this as Sakura seems rather pleased with this arrangement." she said.

While Corrin was shocked by Sakura's apparent reaction to the swap, he continued to argue, "Even so it's too dangerous! She can't be me, she's never fought a battle in her life!"

Orochi appeared to have finished writing on the talisman on the table as she now picked it up and held it in her hand, "Don't worry about that, I've already fixed her. As she is now no one would be able to tell the difference between her and the normal you." Corrin didn't quite understand what she was saying but before he could talk back again she spoke up, "You however need to be fixed! The sweet, gentle Lady Sakura I know would never raise her voice like that to me!" she raised the hand with the Talisman in it and slammed it on the table, a furious burst of energy surging forth from it rushing towards him. He put his hands up to try and defend himself but the light simply passed through them and bombarded his head. He felt dizzy as his vision began to blur, as he felt a little bit nauseous.

As the feelings passed he blinked a couple times and looked up at Orochi, "W-what did you do..?" she said, clenching her hands to her chest, a look of uncertainty on her face.

Orochi smiled warmly, "Oh dear princess, I simply fixed you. You're right, a young lady such as yourself doesn't belong on the battlefield. You can barely lift a steel sword let along swing it around at other people. So I took those skills from you, your rather rough manner of speech and masculine demeanour and replaced it with something more fitting of a princess..." she explained, clearly proud of her handy work, "And don't worry about your Big Brother Corrin, I've already given him everything he needs, same as you. So... do you still think you'd still fair better in battle?"

While Corrin wanted to talk back, to demand her to reverse everything, but she was too afraid to raise her voice against her. And besides, she was right, in this weak delicate body there was nothing he could do to help the battle at the frontlines, and even if that isn't how things were she couldn't even fathom how to fight someone one-on-one. The knowledge she had spent building during her childhood, all the years of sword training, it was all gone. She didn't even remember how to properly hold a blade let alone brandish it against someone. The very idea of rushing into battle terrified her. Staying behind, healing the wounded, tending to the fallen, it safer... helping other people like this is the best she could do. As reality began to hit her hard, she looked to her left where a mirror hanged against a wall.

Staring at her reflect she was greeted with the image of a demure little princess sitting at a table, her pink hair bound by a white and red ribbon that was tied at the back, held in place on the sides by two golden flower shaped hair clips. The cherry blossom coloured hair framed a young innocent looking face, and fell onto a white cape like cloth that draped over her narrow shoulders. She was wearing the rather tight shine maiden outfit that highlighted her slender and delicate form, and a blue ribbon adorned her waist. Looking at the girl in the mirror, there was no one more unsuited to the battlefield. It was rather odd but looking in the mirror she didn't feel anything was out of place, in face, it was stranger to her that she had ever been a man before this point. It wasn't obvious to her prior but after considering it, she felt incredibly comfortable in the shrine maiden dress. Pushing these thoughts to the side and summoning all her courage, she spoke up a bit, "S-so... I'm stuck like this from now on?" she said meekly.

"Well, I suppose I could swap you back if the both of you wished it..." she said, playing with her hair a little bit, "Or you could stay like this. After the charms I cast you are Lady Sakura, in mind, body and spirit. How about that, you got your wish, no one understand her better than you now" she teased, "For now I think you should go visit your brother..." Orochi stood up from her seated position, "Now if you'll excuse me I have some business to attend to, but feel free to come by anytime." and with that Corrin was quickly ushered out of the room.

What had happened was unbelievable! It's like her life had been completely taken from her, and if she didn't do anything about it she'd be Sakura for the rest of her life. It was even starting to become difficult to think of herself as Corrin. Though while her situation seemed grim, Orochi had given her an out. All she had to do was find Sakura in her old body and convince her to swap back!
12112212112.title: Go find Orochi.

121122121121.content:
Corrin made her way to her old quarters and knocked on the door but there was no response. Carefully, she opened the door and took a peek inside. Even thought this was truly her room, or at least use to be, she couldn't shake this odd feeling that she was intruding. After inspecting the room it appeared as though Sakura was else where for the time being. Her train of thought was promptly interrupted as someone behind her suddenly grabbed her shoulders, "Kyaa!" she squealed in shock, probably the most girly sound that had escaped from his lips so far. Slowly turning around she found that the person who had grabbed her was the very person she was looking for. "C-Corrin...?" she uttered, still a little shaken from the shock.

The man in front of her chuckled, "I'm sorry, did I startle you?" he asked, concern in her voice.

"Umm... y-yes, I'm fine though..." Corrin replied, looking up at who was now her brother. It was now brought to her attention how much taller her old form was as she barely reached the height of his old bodies shoulder.

"Wow... I guess Orochi finished with you then..." he said smiling warmly, "My old body is so small... and I can't believe how timid I use to be..." He put his hand on her head and gentle stroked her hair, "I know you promised to protect me, but I guess our roles are a little reverse now aren't they?"

Those words from Sakura strangely eased Corrin a little bit, and while he wouldn't admit it, being pet by her older brother was quite nice. Though he was determined to accomplished what he went there for in the first place, "About that... d-do you think we could swap back?" she asked shyly, "I... I don't think I can live like this..."

Sakura frowned, "I'm sorry, but I really don't want to..." he said.

This answer shocked Corrin, "B-but why...?"

"I've always been so hopeless growing up. I've wanted to help my siblings in battle my whole life but, I just couldn't muster the courage. But now, I can! For the first time in my life I feel confident, like I could take on anyone, and I have incredible sword skills to boot." he explained, "I'm sorry but for now, I can't give up this opportunity!" from the look on her face, Corrin could tell he was dead serious. "So, at least for the time being, I'm Corrin, Prince of Hoshido... and your older brother..."

Corrin's heart sank, it looked as though her old life was out of her grasp for good. She wanted to cry, scream, do something! But before she could, her older brother embraced her, "And I swear I'll keep you safe! The battlefield isn't a place for a delicate flower like yourself Sakura." she suddenly felt at ease.

After a long moment of silence Corrin spoke up, "I... I understand..." she said, "But... if you want to go back, let me know!" she realised that this was probably all she could hope for.

"Of course! And if you ever want to talk about anything, I'm here for you." he replied, smiling once again. With that the two of them parted ways to live each others life.

"Well, as you can see there's not a lot you can do besides ride it out!" Orochi replied with much enthusiasm, "So if we're old settled now, I believe I should go see my older brother Ryouma, we promised to do some training today." he stated as he started to take his leave.

"Wait! Shouldn't we at least set some ground rules or something!" Corrin asked.

"I don't think so. You live your live Orochi, and I'll live my life..." he replied, clearly enjoying it a little too much, "Though if it makes you feel any better, I'll try not to form any romantic connections with anyone. Though, if you wanted to go and find man for yourself, I don't think a young man like me has much of a right to be lecturing a grown woman about love..." she said coyly.

Corrin's face turned a bright red, and she had not even considered that aspect of herself being altered. Before she could even question it herself, she started to take notice of how handsome the young prince standing before her was.

"Well, I'll be leaving now! Make sure if you get married to at least let me know..." she said, laughing as she left the room. He was once again left alone with his thoughts. Somehow her suggestions had made things worse and as was demonstrated before, it was probably unlikely she could tell anyone what had happened to get help on the matter. It was frustrating but she was stuck like this, at least for the time being. "I can't believe Orochi Prince Corrin would do this. If Lady Mikoto was still around, she would teach him not to be so disrespectful to older women..." she muttered, again a little disturbed at how the thought had some out. She decided it was probably a good idea to leave Prince Corrin's room, regardless of what she decided to do next.

He thought about his younger sister Sakura and how life must have been for her. He had heard that his kidnapping was a great cause of sadness for her while she was young. Luckily, it appears as though she had a great friend to help her through it. His mind shifted to Hana, his younger sisters retainer and best friend. Though she appeared to despise him, not that many people in camp didn't right now, he really had a lot of respect for her. She was probably the most hardworking individual in the entire army, never missing a single day of training. And yet at the same time, she still made sure to look after Sakura. Staring at his talisman, he thought he might have a good candidate for who's name to write...
1211221222.title: He wrote a different name.

12112212221.content:
As the ink hit the talisman an energy almost exploded from it, overwhelming all of Corrin's senses. He couldn't see due to the blinding light, the loud hum of the talisman made it impossible to hear anything. He felt as though he was floating in empty space, unable to feel anything around him, before the room began to almost spin around him. As a rush of feelings overwhelmed him he faded out of consciousness. And then, almost as if he barely blinked his eyes everything returned to him without warning. It appeared as though he was standing in one of the outdoor hallways of the castle ground. More notable than that though, he was standing face to face with a tall young man with long red hair tied in a ponytail. Corrin never considered himself a very short but, this man towered above him, his head barely standing as tall as his shoulders. As he awkwardly turned his head up to look at his face, he realised he was facing the pegasus knight from their army, Subaki. He didn't remember him being this tall. Now paying more attention to the one in front of him, Corrin noticed the rather confused look on his face, "Ummm... you alright...?" he said in a concerned tone, "I know you care about your training or whatever, but you'll be no good to Sakura if you burn out..."

Corrin wasn't quite sure of what he was talking about, but responded nonetheless, "I'm fine..." he started, but then trailed off upon hearing a soft, feminine voice speaking for him.

Subaki sighed, "You don't seem okay.... I mean you were just yelling at me and suddenly stopped, staring at me in silence...." he said, placing his hand on his head, "Just... look after yourself. I know we don't always get along, but I do care about you Hana..." he said, petting his head a couple times. Corrin blushed as a fluttering feeling came from his abdomen. After this Subaki turned around and took his leave.

Corrin didn't completely process everything Subaki said until he had already left, but after a couple moments his eyes widened in shock. Did he just call him Hana? All of a sudden everything his him, the locks of light brown hair that fell into his view was something he only took notice of now. Additionally the hair was longer than he was use two, a few locks on it teasing the skin on his nape in an unfamiliar way. He looked down to see that he was wearing a pink kimono-like garment, tied at the waist with a red sash. The way it pulled in narrower at his waists brought to mind the different proportions of the body he now occupied. He wore a white and gold chest plate over the silk clothes he donned that likely now contained a modest pair of breasts, though this was a though he'd rather not dwell on. Additionally, the exposed skin of his thighs was quite a bit different, as he usually wore attire that covered a majority of his body. It would appear as though the talisman had indeed given him a means of understanding Hana better, by becoming her.

"Well... I guess that explains why Subaki looked so tall..." she muttered to herself. The very idea of becoming another person was quite strange. While Hana was one of the strongest and most skilled warriors in the army, her build was still rather petite and slender. She was a fighter very similar to herself, making use of speed and technique to compensate her lack of overwhelming physical strength. While this seemed like a pretty good opportunity she was rather torn as it appeared as though the talisman was definitely used up in the process of being cast. Did that mean she was stuck like this? Was that such a bad thing? It probably would be a good idea to check if Orochi had a way to reverse this. On the other hand, maybe she should check on her own body. After all, if she was Hana then Hana was probably her.

“How about I show you my new recipe? I perfected today and it only needs to be warmed up.” Charlotte offered.

“Sure.” Corrin replied.

Charlotte smirked as she went to prep the food. A few minutes later she came back with a nice warm meal. “Eat up. It may be the last one you may ever want!” Charlotte cheerfully said as she put a plate for Corrin and herself.

Corrin smiled as she began to eat. Corrin remembered Charlotte’s great cooking and this tasted even better since then. Charlotte seemed to enjoy herself too. After a few minutes though, Corrin found herself getting dizzy. “Charlotte? What’s-” Corrin muttered before losing consciousness…

It had been a long day of battle. The army had gotten into a rather large battle with morphs on the Dread Isle, the battle had to be spread out for miles across the battlefield leaving the ranks thin. Eliwood as leader of the army insisted on not putting others in danger and going after a large group alone, but the tactician Mark always insisted for some reason to slit groups off into 2, usually one man and woman. It was a wide theory in the army that the tactician was secretly trying to play matchmaker with the soldiers, but since it actually seemed to work in most cases nobody complained too much. So was such a matter today, Mark insisted Eliwood travel with the cleric turned powerful light bishop Serra. And Serra was very happy about this, what better way to add more of her influence of the army by turning the leader into a close copy of herself.

The battle raged on, and after every encounter even if Eliwood only had a scratch, Serra would heal him with her magically modified staff. Eliwood found it a bit bothersome, after all he could always just use a vulinary or just deal with a few scratched but Serra always insisted. And after a few hours of battle she began seeing results, Eliwood's red hair was becoming much longer, down to below his shoulders. Eliwood also was no almost tripping over his armor that his body was becoming too small for. After slicing through what he hoped to be the last morph with his mighty gigantic sword Durandal Eliwood collapsed on the battlefield.

"My lord!" Serra called out giving Eliwood the last tap from the modified heal staff before it finally broke. When Eliwood looked up to Serra, she saw that his face was now closer to her's than his. It was much softer and his armor was now practically falling off of him. "Serra, I think something's wrong, I may have been effected by a weakening poison of some sort. Did you bring a Restore staff with you?"

"I did not lord Eliwood, they were all used up after the last battle." Eliwood cursed quietly to himself not wanting to swear in front of a lady. Serra put a hand on Eliwood, "Let me help you out of that armor to get a look at you to see how you've changed...by the poison." Serra smiled at her little lie and helped Eliwood remove his top layer of armor and let out a fake gasp. "My lord! You have a bosom!"

Eliwood thought Serra's statement was the most ridiculous thing he'd ever heard, had the girl not seen a man's pecs before? But sure enough when he looked down he saw he had a very distinctly feminine chest. "What the..." He said and he felt a surge of confused adrenaline as he stood up and moved behind a bush and check his lower half. Eliwood called out in a voice that he now noticed was much higher than his own, "I've...I've become a woman!"

Serra was elated, her spell had worked! Eliwood now looked like a woman who was a mix of himself and Serra. Serra wished Eliwood looked more like her, but he still made for a cute girl. Something Serra could help out more with even without the use of magic. "My lord! I mean, my lady, no wonder you were getting so tired waling around in that armor. If I wore something like that all day I'd have passed out, here, put this on." And Serra with a gleam in her eye took a spare dress from her bag that she brought for this exact occation and practically jumped into behind the bush with Eliwood who was in too much shock to fight against the determined bishop.
________________

As the two army members began the trek back to camp Serra couldn't help but admire her handywork. The marquess of Pherae was practically unrecognizable with his long red hair now tied up in pigtails, his perky breasts that were contained in a long blue version of Serra's lilac colored dress that she thought really brought out his bright blue eyes even more. Although he was still carrying his old armor and weapons in a sack that he was practically dragging. Apparently he didn't think it was a good idea to leave his armor and legendary sword around on the ground although Serra thought it made Eliwood look rather silly.

The two made it back to camp and went straight for Mark's tent. Eliwood wanted to tell the truth, but Serra insisted that they should say Eliwood stayed behind to nobelly protect a small village for a while and sent a cute cleric in training to help with the army. Eliwood agreed with this mainly because he was a little embarrassed by his current form and didn't want the leader of the army to be seen as not as strong as he was before. After all, now he could barely hold a sword. But Serra had been good enough to teach him to use a staff on the journey back so he could still contribute to the army.

"Yoo hoo! Mark! Your favorite cutie of St. Eliminate is back!"

Mark who was looking down at the weird purple device he used to plan out tactics rolled his eyes upon hearing the grating voice and looked up to say, "Good, I don't believe you and Eliwood have a proper Support so I will pair you up with...who is this young lady?"

Serra gave the made up story about Eliwood leaving and this young cleric who she named 'Ellie' was joining the army. Eliwood expected Mark to be furious that Eliwood had not showed up back at camp but instead seemed rather excited. "This is great! I leads to more pairing options and evens out the gender balance more."

Eliwood felt a bit annoyed, it seemed the rumors of the tactician pairing up men and women on the battlefield for romantic reasons might be more true than he thought. Mark approached Eliwood and looked him up and down, Eliwood went to cover up his chest instinctively, he didn't like being looked over like this. Eliwood could have sworn he heard the tactician mutter, "Seems a bit under leveled, but I can fix that," and he went back to his little purple planning...thing.

"Ellie, I'm going to send you on a training mission with one of the men to see how you do. Be sure to use your heal staff a lot to gain experience. And report back to me later so I can check your progress."

Fatigued and vulnerable, the Shaman waited until Eirika lowered her guard, surveying the battlefield, and then leapt into action. 15311112212.content:
As Eirika surveyed the battlefield, looking for an opening she could take or a weak point in her army's defenses that she could reinforce, she suddenly felt a strange tingling all over her body. It was similar to the feeling she got when a staff was used on her, but none of the staff users in her army were anywhere nearby. She figured it must have been the work of an enemy healer of some sort, and decided to try and take out whoever it was before she succumbed to the effects of whatever staff they were using on her. However, she found herself unable to do so. For some reason, her legs didn't seem to be obeying her commands.

"W-What? What's going on?" She'd seen the effects of offensive staves before, like Sleep and Berserk, but she couldn't remember encountering anything like this before. She tried in vain to get her legs to move, as the tingling feeling intensified, but to no avail. The feeling was maddening. It had all but vanished from her upper body, but it continued to intensify in her legs, building up as if it were ready to burst.

And then all of a sudden, it did. Her boots suddenly burst apart as her legs began to grow. If not for her legs being firmly planted to the ground, she'd almost certainly have fallen. Her legs grew longer, thicker, stronger. Her feet hardened, toes shrinking back inside, as they became a pair of hooves. A fine coat of brown hair coated her equine legs, while much thicker, coarser hair grew out from her waist, where her human torso met her equine lower half, hanging out the bottom of her skirt.

Eirika was understandably afraid right now, shocked into silence, but the worst was far from over. The back of her skirt was suddenly lifted up as a second pair of equine legs suddenly erupted from behind her, ruining her underwear in the process. Her new back legs eventually touched the ground, but not before an entire horse-like body had ground out behind her, all coated in the same brown hair that coated her from legs. A long, horse tail erupted from her rear.

After that, the transformations seemed to stop, but Eirika was still in shock. Her legs had basically been replaced with the body of a horse, with her torso where the horse's head and neck should be. In a moment of clarity, she recognised her new form as that of a Tarvos, half-man, half-horse creatures that served the Demon King. Whoever was responsible for this had turned her into a fiend! Her legs seemed to be able to move now, but even if she wasn't still in shock, she had no idea how to move around as a quadruped, which would hamper her mobility greatly.

Thanks to her shocked silence, none of her army had noticed her predicament just yet, as she desperately tried to calm herself. If this was anything like the effects of Sleep or Berserk, she should still be able to reclaim her human form with a Restore staff. Of course, that meant exposing her new form to at least one of the healers in the group, and actually walking over to them with her new horse-like body. She sighed, doing her best to figure out how to walk like this, thankful that at least whatever had gone on was done with her, and the offending enemy didn't seem to still be nearby.

Ephraim fell to his knees exhausted against the constant mental onslaught from the ritual, even someone with his strength and will power was at his limit. "Oh dear, looks like you've finally run out of options. No escaping this time." Valter said, very happy that this pest would finally be dealt with in a very enjoyable manner.

The seal glowed brighter as the red magical lightning surrounded Ephraim and caused him to float in the air. "D-Damn...you..." was all her could get out before the magic surrounded and totally consumed him. He could feel his morals fading, death and blood going from a necessity to a pass time as he saw Valter and felt his heart beat with admiration. As his mind was being changed so too was his body, his hair growing out and becoming a more vivid turquoise color before being wrapped into short twintails. His body paled, and his face was coated in this white makeup, his lips being stained a jet black and dark eye shadow appearing over his eyelids while a very thick coat of eye liner surrounded his eyes. A black heart appeared on each cheek as well, while lower down his clothing began to alter. His armor already blown off, his clothing altered and expanded greatly as they turned into a large frilly black and red gothic lolita dress with some lace and gothic heart designs along it. Long gloves covered his hands and fancy black boots with long striped black and white stockings his feet. He looked extremely feminine now, and was nearly unrecognizable and the transformation finished.

Valter got off his Wyvern as the ritual ended and Ephraim slowly fell to the ground on his feet. When he opened his eyes, they opened up very wide and a cheerfully sinister smiled appeared along his black lips to give him quite the creepy expression. Giggling, the corrupted lord skipped over to Valter and gave him a kiss on the cheek before wrapping around his arm. "It is an honor to serve you Master Valter, tehehe~" he said with a wide grin. His very essence was corrupted to it's core by that ritual. His troops, his sister, none of that mattered to him. All her cared about now was serving his darling Valter. "It worked even better than I expected! Hahaha, I could get used to this!" Valter said, his enemy now his arm candy.
15312111.title: Ephraim falls under Valter's spell

15511111.content:
Faye trudged back to her tent, her arms wrapped around a spellbook. There had to something in there that would get Alm to like her back, or at least, that's what she believed. The longer this war went on, the more apparent it became that she would not be able to win Alm's heart through normal means, as it already belonged to someone else. She tried to be happy for him, to just be there to support him as a friend, but she couldn't handle it. She was desperate now, and was willing to resort to magic in order to get what she wanted.

Once she reached her tent, she immediately slammed the book down, and started flipping through the pages frantically, looking for what she needed. She may have glanced past several useful spells in her haste, but she ultimately found something that seemed like what she needed. Supposedly the spell was meant to "make the target like you". That sounded perfect! Snatching up the spellbook in her hands, she quickly ran off to find Alm.

After not too much time searching, Faye managed to find Alm practicing his swordplay just outside the camp. He was focused on his training, and hadn't noticed her approach. That was good; if Alm realised she was trying to cast a spell on him, he might try to stop her, and then he'd definitely never like her back. Using what little magic she'd learned from Kliff and Silque, Faye read out the spell, casting it on Alm. Unfortunately, if she hadn't been in such a rush, and had bothered to read further than just the title, she might have realised that the spell had a very different meaning in mind when it said it would "make the target like you"...

A sly grin was plastered across Nuibaba's face as she observed Alm's approach through her crystal ball. That boy was proving quite a problem for the Rigellian Army, even having bested Berkut on multiple occasions, but thanks to a little manipulation, he had stopped him march on Rigel for the time being, and was instead headed towards her abode.

Of course, Alm was no ordinary soldier. He was one of the Brand Bearers, and he would be quite useful to her own plans. Nuibaba had been sacrificing young Rigellian girls in order to retain her own youth, but if she sacrificed a Brand Bearer, she should become immortal. There was only one issue; Nuibaba wasn't sure if Alm was a suitable sacrifice. In the past, she had specifically sacrificed young girls, and despite being a Brand Bearer, Alm did not meet that qualification. Perhaps being a Brand Bearer would make him a suitable sacrifice, regardless of his gender, but Nuibaba wasn't going to take that risk, especially considering there was another Brand Bearer who would be a more suitable sacrifice.

She wasn't luring Alm to her abode for nothing, though. There was still much that could be done. For example, if Alm wasn't a suitable sacrifice, perhaps she could simply make him into one. So long as he kept the Brand on his hand, other modifications shouldn't effect his status as a Brand Bearer. Although, there was no guarantee that changing his body would make him a suitable sacrifice. Instead, she could make him her slave, warping and twisting his mind and body to her will. She could have him lure the other Brand Bearer to her abode, ready to be sacrificed. As Alm continued to near her abode, Nuibaba weighed up her options about what she should do with him.

15521112.content:
Alfonse let out a small sigh as he scoured the area. He was almost certain there were more important things he could have been doing right now, but his commander, Anna, had insisted that he help out.

The Order of Heroes depended on their summoner being able to summon heroes from other worlds to aid them in battle and bolster their ranks. Normally, this would be done by purchasing a summoning stone using orbs, and then having their summoner fire the divine relic Breidablik at the stone to activate their summoning ruins, and call forth a new hero. Unfortunately, the Order was in a bit of a tough spot at the moment, and orb supplies were running low. As such, Anna had sent the Order out to where these summoning stones were usually found, in the hopes that they'd be able to find some before the people who sold them.

Alfonse didn't know how much luck the others were having, but his search was proving fruitless. He'd found not a single summoning stone in all the time he'd been searching. He was considering just giving up and heading back empty handed, since there didn't seem to be any hope of finding any. However, as luck would have it, just as he was turning around to head back to Anna, his foot collided with something hard hidden in the grass.

"Hm? Is this...?" Alfonse mumbled to himself, reaching down into the grass to pull out what he'd found. As he suspected, the smooth, round, object was indeed a summoning stone. A small smile graced his face as he realised he'd no longer be going back empty handed.

However, Alfonse only got the briefest of glimpses as the colour of the stone before it suddenly began to glow, as it had been activated by Breidablik. "What? What's going on?" Before long, the glowing light began to spread out from the stone, engulfing the surrounding area. Alfonse had a feeling he was in trouble now. Normally, their summoner stood back away from the stone, the give the new hero ample room to appear, but somehow, the stone seemed to be summoning on its own with Alfonse stuck right at the centre. Most people would probably have dropped the stone and ran, regardless of what it might do or which hero was contained within, but for some reason, Alfonse couldn't bring himself to drop it, and he was stuck standing firmly in place with the stone clenched in his hand.

As the light grew blinding, Alfonse felt a wave of energy rush through him, the summoning being performed. He just hoped that whatever side effects standing in the middle of a summoning might have weren't too severe.

What did the stone do to Alfonse?
15521112.title: Summoning gone wrong

15521112311.content:
Alfonse began to clutch his head tightly, a parting headache coming over him.

Seeing their friend in pain, Kiran quickly ran over to help. "Hey Alfonse! Are you ok?"

A smile appeared on Alfonse's face as he heard the summoner's worries. He was such a sweetie, caring for him so much. "I'm great darling~" Alfonse responded lovingly. "Never felt better."

Kiran looked at him with a confused face. "Uh... Ok, then. That's good." He didn't know why Alfonse had referred to him as 'darling', but knowing that his friend wasn't hurt was enough to calm his worry. "Let's just get back to looking for more orbs, alright?"

As Alfonse gave a gentle nod, the two parted ways in order to look for more summoning stones. Alfonse wiped the dirt of his clothes. Wow, he didn't realize he was dressing so plain at the moment. This drab boring outfit was functional for battle, but no fun at all. Something prettier and with more purple would be very nice. Oh, and if he could get something that accentuated his muscles and male organ that would be great too. Catching the eyes of other males and females was always so much fun~

But that would have to wait. Right now he had to accomplish a mission for his dear Kiran, and that was to find more orbs. Unbeknownst to him, was the fact that he had started acting more like another hero from the World of Heroes, Loki.
15521112311.title: The World of Heroes

1552111232.content:
As the light slowly died down again, Alfonse dared to open his eyes once more. His body still felt kind of weird, but thankfully, nothing seemed to be out of place. In fact, after some thorough examination, he concluded that nothing had changed about him at all. There was also no evidence of any Hero being summoned, leaving Alfonse to wonder what exactly the light as about.

He still held the stone in his hand, but its light had dimmed, as if it had already been used up. Clearly it should have done something, but with nothing obviously different about himself, a no new Hero standing beside him, he had no idea what it might have done. With a small sigh, he began to walk back to base, clutching the stone in his hand, allowing the mystery roll around in his head.

~~~

"Alfonse! There you are!" Anna called out as Alfonse approached. It seemed he was the last to arrive, having travelled the furthest out from the base. Anna stood alongside Alfonse's sister, Sharena, and the Order of Heroes' summoner, Kiran, and behind them was a small pile of summoning stones. "Did you find anything?"

"Just one, Commander," he said, a little embarrassed as he presented the stone he was carrying.

"It looks like it's already been used," Kiran mused, more familiar with summoning stones than the rest of the group.

"Yes, it does. It looked normal when I first found it, but then it suddenly started glowing, and the area round me lit up, like it was summoning something, but there was no one besides me when it faded."

No one seemed to have a solid answer for what had happened, being just as clueless as Alfonse had been when it first happened. "Was that all that happened? Nothing else changed after the stone lit up?" Kiran asked.

"Well, my body felt a little strange, but nothing seemed to be different."

That was when Sharena decided to speak up, sounding as excited as ever. "Oh! Maybe the stone's power went into you! Maybe you can summon other Heroes now!"

"Sharena, I don't think that's how summoning stones work."

"It's worth a try, at least," Anna suggested. "We won't know what happened if we don't try anything. Plus, if you can summon using the stones power, that's going to save us a lot of orbs." Of course Anna would be thinking about ways to save money.

Alfonse sighed. "Very well." He took a few steps back, just in case it really did work, closed his eyes, and concentrated. He wasn't sure if he should be focusing on any one Hero in particular, and so instead, he just tried to focus on the weird feeling that hadn't entirely subsided within him. Eventually, a light reached his closed eyes, much to his surprise. Was it really working? Unbeknownst to him, however, it wasn't the stone that was glowing this time, nor was there a pillar of light to signal the arrival of the new Hero. Instead, it was his body that shone, glowing brighter to hide the way it reshaped into a new form, taking on the appearance of a Hero that could have been summoned with his stone.

What colour was the stone he found, though?

info.brief_description: Characters from the Fire Emblem franchise undergo some forms of changes
info.description:
Yet another transformation story I had on my mind that nobody has done. This one is Fire Emblem. While not one of Nintendo's more well known franchises, I feel it's earned it's place. Here's the rules.

1. For Characters Robin and Corrin, Their default male and female designs will be used for simplicity. I know they can be customised, but let's not make things too complex.
2. No doing a simple gender bender for those two characters either. What I mean is don't just turn them from male to female(and vice versa). The reason for this is because you'd be just turning them into their variant that already exists, and that would really provide much in terms of story. Simple gender bender is alright with everyone else, but be more creative with these two.
3. No stories about a Manakete transforming into a dragon. That's cheating because it's a natural transformation for them. You'd just be writing an ordinary Fire Emblem story by doing that. That goes for any natural transformations. You could have somebody who's not a manakete get turned into one.
4. Playable Allies who start off as enemy characters go in the category of playable allies. That said, If they are only playable for one chapter in the game and later defect to fighting for the enemy (such is the case of Orson from Sacred Stones), those ones are placed in with enemy characters.
5. Awakenings DLC allies do not count for playable in Awakening. Amiibo characters do not count for playable allies for Fates. Also, any characters that are acquired as allies post game in their respective game do not go in that category either such as main enemies in Sacred Stones.
6. This should go without saying but, don't go killing off whoever the main focus of the story is. If the protagonist dies, there is no story.

Next up, We have one character who is a special case. That Character is Anna. It's established there is already more than one Anna, and she appears in many games as an NPC. She's playable in Awakening and Fates. The said, She will be in both the Playable and non Playable categories. The reason for this being differentiating the playable Annas from the non playable Annas.

That's that. We can begin whenever.
